Quotes.author: F. W. de Klerk

Quotes.quote: A good man often appears gauche simply because he does not take advantage of the myriad mean little chances of making himself look stylish. Preferring truth to form, he is not constantly at work upon the facade of his appearance.
Quotes.author: Alanis Morissette

Quotes.quote: If I can get you to laugh with me, you like me better, which makes you more open to my ideas. And if I can persuade you to laugh at the particular point I make, by laughing at it you acknowledge its truth.
Quotes.author: John Cleese

Quotes.quote: The possession of arbitrary power has always, the world over, tended irresistibly to destroy humane sensibility, magnanimity, and truth.
Quotes.author: Frederick Law Olmsted

Quotes.quote: The truth is that I don't have a favourite goal. I remember important goals more than I do favourite goals, like goals in the Champions League where I had the opportunity to have scored in both finals I have played in. Finals in the World Cup or Copa del Rey are the ones that have stayed with me for longer or that I remember more.
Quotes.author: Lionel Messi

Quotes.quote: I have nothing new to teach the world. Truth and Non-violence are as old as the hills. All I have done is to try experiments in both on as vast a scale as I could.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: The truth is I love being alive. And I love feeling free. So if I can't have those things then I feel like a caged animal and I'd rather not be in a cage. I'd rather be dead. And it's real simple. And I think it's not that uncommon.
Quotes.author: Angelina Jolie

Quotes.quote: There are two ways of lying. One, not telling the truth and the other, making up statistics.
Quotes.author: Josefina Vazquez Mota

Quotes.quote: Racism oppresses its victims, but also binds the oppressors, who sear their consciences with more and more lies until they become prisoners of those lies. They cannot face the truth of human equality because it reveals the horror of the injustices they commit.
Quotes.author: Alveda King

Quotes.quote: It is not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, that the lover of knowledge is reluctant to step into its waters.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: God's truth judges created things out of love, and Satan's truth judges them out of envy and hatred.
Quotes.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

Quotes.quote: Fiction is the truth inside the lie.
Quotes.author: Stephen King

Quotes.quote: The truth is that neither British nor American imperialism was or is idealistic. It has always been driven by economic or strategic interests.
Quotes.author: Charley Reese

Quotes.quote: Honest communication is built on truth and integrity and upon respect of the one for the other.
Quotes.author: Benjamin E. Mays

Quotes.quote: Clouds and darkness surround us, yet Heaven is just, and the day of triumph will surely come, when justice and truth will be vindicated.
Quotes.author: Mary Todd Lincoln

Quotes.quote: Politeness and civility are the best capital ever invested in business. Large stores, gilt signs, flaming advertisements, will all prove unavailing if you or your employees treat your patrons abruptly. The truth is, the more kind and liberal a man is, the more generous will be the patronage bestowed upon him.
Quotes.author: P. T. Barnum

Quotes.quote: My parents, and librarians along the way, taught me about the space between words; about the margins, where so many juicy moments of life and spirit and friendship could be found. In a library, you could find miracles and truth and you might find something that would make you laugh so hard that you get shushed, in the friendliest way.
Quotes.author: Anne Lamott

Quotes.quote: Tell the truth, work hard, and come to dinner on time.
Quotes.author: Gerald R. Ford

Quotes.quote: God, as Truth, has been for me a treasure beyond price. May He be so to every one of us.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: One of the peculiar sins of the twentieth century which we've developed to a very high level is the sin of credulity. It has been said that when human beings stop believing in God they believe in nothing. The truth is much worse: they believe in anything.
Quotes.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

Quotes.quote: The opposite of a fact is falsehood, but the opposite of one profound truth may very well be another profound truth.
Quotes.author: Niels Bohr

Quotes.quote: There are also two kinds of truths: truth of reasoning and truths of fact. Truths of reasoning are necessary and their opposite is impossible; those of fact are contingent and their opposite is possible.
Quotes.author: Gottfried Leibniz

Quotes.quote: The oblique paradox of propaganda is that the lie in the throat becomes, by repetition, the truth in the heart.
Quotes.author: John Grierson

Quotes.quote: In the case of maternal health care, you look at, well naturally, it's the mother who's the customer, who makes the decisions. But in truth, the mother in many areas, in certain parts of India, the mother has very little decision-making power at all. The real decision-maker is the mother-in-law.
Quotes.author: Jacqueline Novogratz

Quotes.quote: Richard Nixon is a no good, lying bastard. He can lie out of both sides of his mouth at the same time, and if he ever caught himself telling the truth, he'd lie just to keep his hand in.
Quotes.author: Harry S Truman

Quotes.quote: Rebellion without truth is like spring in a bleak, arid desert.
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: Memory is a complicated thing, a relative to truth, but not its twin.
Quotes.author: Barbara Kingsolver

Quotes.quote: Attempting to get at truth means rejecting stereotypes and cliches.
Quotes.author: Harold Evans

Quotes.quote: I think life is difficult and that's that. I am not at all - absolutely not at all - interested in the pursuit of happiness. I am not interested in the pursuit of positivity. I am interested in pursuing a truth, and the truth often seems to be not happiness but its opposite.
Quotes.author: Jamaica Kincaid

Quotes.quote: One of the pitfalls of writing about illness is that it is very easy to imagine people with cancer as either these wise, beyond-their-years creatures or else these sad-eyed, tragic people. And the truth is people living with cancer are very much like people who are not living with cancer.
Quotes.author: John Green

Quotes.quote: I can't say why people lie; they just do. Everyone has their own reasons for not telling the truth.
Quotes.author: Eric Carr

Quotes.quote: The truth is that we don't need everyone to like us; we need a few people to love us. Because what's better than being roundly liked is being fully known - an impossibility both professionally and personally if you're so busy being likable that you forget to be yourself.
Quotes.author: Jessica Valenti

Quotes.quote: The truth is that we can learn to condition our minds, bodies, and emotions to link pain or pleasure to whatever we choose. By changing what we link pain and pleasure to, we will instantly change our behaviors.
Quotes.author: Tony Robbins

Quotes.quote: It is my feeling that Time ripens all things; with Time all things are revealed; Time is the father of truth.
Quotes.author: Francois Rabelais

Quotes.quote: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
Quotes.author: Carl Jung

Quotes.quote: There are, in truth, no specialties in medicine, since to know fully many of the most important diseases a man must be familiar with their manifestations in many organs.
Quotes.author: William Osler

Quotes.quote: You know, I think many people have the mistaken impression that Congress regulates Wall Street. In truth that's not the case. The real truth is that Wall Street regulates the Congress.
Quotes.author: Bernie Sanders

Quotes.quote: Our situation today shows that beauty demands for itself at least as much courage and decision as do truth and goodness, and she will not allow herself to be separated and banned from her two sisters without taking them along with herself in an act of mysterious vengeance.
Quotes.author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

Quotes.quote: When a truth is necessary, the reason for it can be found by analysis, that is, by resolving it into simpler ideas and truths until the primary ones are reached.
Quotes.author: Gottfried Leibniz

Quotes.quote: And we should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once. And we should call every truth false which was not accompanied by at least one laugh.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: Without accepting the fact that everything changes, we cannot find perfect composure. But unfortunately, although it is true, it is difficult for us to accept it. Because we cannot accept the truth of transience, we suffer.
Quotes.author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quotes.quote: But one of the things I learned is that when you fight for something you believe in and you tell the truth and you do your best, you can always hold your head up high and no one can take that away from you.
Quotes.author: Vanessa Kerry

Quotes.quote: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods.
Quotes.author: Albert Einstein

Quotes.quote: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: I am not afraid of the pen, or the scaffold, or the sword. I will tell the truth wherever I please.
Quotes.author: Mother Jones

Quotes.quote: The tendency of modern scientific teaching is to neglect the great books, to lay far too much stress upon relatively unimportant modern work, and to present masses of detail of doubtful truth and questionable weight in such a way as to obscure principles.
Quotes.author: Ronald Fisher

Quotes.quote: The truth is, we're all cyborgs with cell phones and online identities.
Quotes.author: Geoff Johns

Quotes.quote: The Cold War had become a battlefield marked by doublespeak. Disguise, distortion, and deception were accepted as reality. Truth was promised in a serum.
Quotes.author: Annie Jacobsen

Quotes.quote: The truth is, no one of us can be free until everybody is free.
Quotes.author: Maya Angelou

Quotes.quote: Why shouldn't truth be stranger than fiction? Fiction, after all, has to make sense.
Quotes.author: Mark Twain

Quotes.quote: You don't have to sort of enhance reality. There is nothing stranger than truth.
Quotes.author: Annie Leibovitz

Quotes.quote: Art is not merely an imitation of the reality of nature, but in truth a metaphysical supplement to the reality of nature, placed alongside thereof for its conquest.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: I am a lover of truth, a worshipper of freedom, a celebrant at the altar of language and purity and tolerance.
Quotes.author: Stephen Fry

Quotes.quote: You believe happiness to be derived from the place in which once you have been happy, but in truth it is centered in ourselves.
Quotes.author: Franz Schubert

Quotes.quote: Your aim as a photographer is to get a picture of that person that means something. Portraits aren't fantasies; they need to tell a truth.
Quotes.author: Tim Walker

Quotes.quote: In truth, I am a single mother. But I don't feel alone at all in parenting my daughter. Krishna has a whole other side of her family who loves her, too. And so Krishna is parented by me, but also by her grandmother and aunts and cousins and uncles and friends.
Quotes.author: Padma Lakshmi

Quotes.quote: There is a distinction between fact and truth. Truth has an element of revelation about it. If something is true, it does more than strike one as merely being so.
Quotes.author: Lucian Freud

Quotes.quote: Here's the thing with me and the religious thing. This is the flat-out truth: I find the religiosity and philosophy in the music. I don't find it anywhere else.
Quotes.author: Bob Dylan

Quotes.quote: Defending the truth is not something one does out of a sense of duty or to allay guilt complexes, but is a reward in itself.
Quotes.author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quotes.quote: Humor is something that thrives between man's aspirations and his limitations. There is more logic in humor than in anything else. Because, you see, humor is truth.
Quotes.author: Victor Borge

Quotes.quote: Scarce any problem will appear more hard and difficult, than that of determining the distance of the Sun from the Earth very near the truth: but even this... will without much labour be effected.
Quotes.author: Edmond Halley

Quotes.quote: No one should ever say that it was my ignorance if I did or showed forth anything however small according to God's good pleasure; but let this be your conclusion and let it so be thought, that - as is the perfect truth - it was the gift of God.
Quotes.author: Saint Patrick

Quotes.quote: The truth is that there is only one terminal dignity - love. And the story of a love is not important - what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
Quotes.author: Helen Hayes

Quotes.quote: Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time.
Quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

Quotes.quote: Words can be said in bitterness and anger, and often there seems to be an element of truth in the nastiness. And words don't go away, they just echo around.
Quotes.author: Jane Goodall

Quotes.quote: Truth is on the side of the oppressed.
Quotes.author: Malcolm X

Quotes.quote: Truth is the daughter of time, and I feel no shame in being her midwife.
Quotes.author: Johannes Kepler

Quotes.quote: The sad truth is that opportunity doesn't knock twice.
Quotes.author: Gloria Estefan

Quotes.quote: There are various eyes. Even the Sphinx has eyes: and as a result there are various truths, and as a result there is no truth.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: Representation of the world, like the world itself, is the work of men; they describe it from their own point of view, which they confuse with the absolute truth.
Quotes.author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quotes.quote: It is hard to believe that a man is telling the truth when you know that you would lie if you were in his place.
Quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

Quotes.quote: God is, even though the whole world deny him. Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
Quotes.author: Jules Verne

Quotes.quote: The truth is that I oppose the Iraq war, just as I opposed the Vietnam War, because these two conflicts have weakened the U.S. and diminished our standing in the world and our national security.
Quotes.author: George McGovern

Quotes.quote: The truth is, no matter what your lifestyle or occupation, nothing can really stop you when you're allowing yourself to be exactly who you want to be.
Quotes.author: Hayley Williams

Quotes.quote: When I was a young person I went to the university and I learned a rational language, to think with the left side of the brain. But in the right side of the brain you have intuition and imagination. Words are not the truth; they indicate the way to go, but you need to go alone, in silence. Symbols have a language that kills the words.
Quotes.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

Quotes.quote: You can't get there alone. People have to help you, and I do believe in karma. I believe in paybacks. You get people to help you by telling the truth, by being earnest.
Quotes.author: Randy Pausch

Quotes.quote: All religion seems to need to prove that it's the only truth. And that's where it turns demonic. Because that's when you get religious wars and persecutions and burning heretics at the stake.
Quotes.author: John Shelby Spong

Quotes.quote: My parents taught me honesty, truth, compassion, kindness and how to care for people. Also, they encouraged me to take risks, to boldly go. They taught me that the greatest danger in life is not taking the adventure.
Quotes.author: Brian Blessed

Quotes.quote: If you're a prosecutor, and you believe the defendant is guilty, you only talk about ultimate truth, but not intermediate truth. If you're the defense attorney, you care deeply about intermediate truth, but you tend to neglect ultimate truth.
Quotes.author: Alan Dershowitz

Quotes.quote: You will find truth more quickly through delight than gravity. Let out a little more string on your kite.
Quotes.author: Alan Cohen

Quotes.quote: Music makes me high on stage, and that's the truth. It's like being almost addicted to music.
Quotes.author: Jimi Hendrix

Quotes.quote: It does not require many words to speak the truth.
Quotes.author: Chief Joseph

Quotes.quote: Pleasure without God, without the sacred boundaries, will actually leave you emptier than before. And this is biblical truth, this is experiential truth. The loneliest people in the world are amongst the wealthiest and most famous who found no boundaries within which to live. That is a fact I've seen again and again.
Quotes.author: Ravi Zacharias

Quotes.quote: I talk about the gods, I am an atheist. But I am an artist too, and therefore a liar. Distrust everything I say. I am telling the truth.
Quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quotes.quote: The history of science shows that theories are perishable. With every new truth that is revealed we get a better understanding of Nature and our conceptions and views are modified.
Quotes.author: Nikola Tesla

Quotes.quote: The sea - this truth must be confessed - has no generosity. No display of manly qualities - courage, hardihood, endurance, faithfulness - has ever been known to touch its irresponsible consciousness of power.
Quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

Quotes.quote: Country music is the people's music. It just speaks about real life and about truth and it tells things how they really are.
Quotes.author: Faith Hill

Quotes.quote: To the scientist there is the joy in pursuing truth which nearly counteracts the depressing revelations of truth.
Quotes.author: H. P. Lovecraft

Quotes.quote: Irony regards every simple truth as a challenge.
Quotes.author: Mason Cooley

Quotes.quote: The truth is the best picture, the best propaganda.
Quotes.author: Robert Capa

Quotes.quote: I was bold in the pursuit of knowledge, never fearing to follow truth and reason to whatever results they led, and bearding every authority which stood in their way.
Quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes.quote: To the living we owe respect, but to the dead we owe only the truth.
Quotes.author: Voltaire

Quotes.quote: Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established, that, unless we love the truth, we cannot know it.
Quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes.quote: There is no better way of exercising the imagination than the study of law. No poet ever interpreted nature as freely as a lawyer interprets the truth.
Quotes.author: Jean Giraudoux

Quotes.quote: The scientist only imposes two things, namely truth and sincerity, imposes them upon himself and upon other scientists.
Quotes.author: Erwin Schrodinger

Quotes.quote: Now all we need is to continue to speak the truth fearlessly, and we shall add to our number those who will turn the scale to the side of equal and full justice in all things.
Quotes.author: Lucy Stone

Quotes.quote: I hate newspapermen. They come into camp and pick up their camp rumors and print them as facts. I regard them as spies, which, in truth, they are.
Quotes.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

Quotes.quote: Postmodernism was a reaction to modernism. Where modernism was about objectivity, postmodernism was about subjectivity. Where modernism sought a singular truth, postmodernism sought the multiplicity of truths.
Quotes.author: Miguel Syjuco

Quotes.quote: It is error alone which needs the support of government. Truth can stand by itself.
Quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes.quote: They whom truth and wisdom lead, can gather honey from a weed.
Quotes.author: William Cowper

Quotes.quote: I don't want to waste anyone's time or money. I want to give people some truth and positive heart lift.
Quotes.author: Mos Def

Quotes.quote: Madness is the absolute break with the work of art; it forms the constitutive moment of abolition, which dissolves in time the truth of the work of art.
Quotes.author: Michel Foucault

Quotes.quote: Truth is a great flirt.
Quotes.author: Franz Liszt

Quotes.quote: War is wrong. Conscription for war is inconsistent with freedom of conscience, which is not merely the right to believe but to act on the degree of truth that one receives, to follow a vocation which is God-inspired and God-directed.
Quotes.author: Bayard Rustin

Quotes.quote: Truth is something which can't be told in a few words. Those who simplify the universe only reduce the expansion of its meaning.
Quotes.author: Anais Nin

Quotes.quote: Sometimes we look at gay being a bigger sin than being proud or not telling the truth. I don't think God categorizes sins.
Quotes.author: Joel Osteen

Quotes.quote: For thousands of years, human beings have been obsessed with beauty, truth, love, honor, altruism, courage, social relationships, art, and God. They all go together as subjective experiences, and it's a straw man to set God up as the delusion. If he is, then so is truth itself or beauty itself.
Quotes.author: Deepak Chopra

Quotes.quote: God is another name for human intelligence raised above all error and imperfection, and extended to all possible truth.
Quotes.author: William Ellery Channing

Quotes.quote: I'm always trying to do the impossible to please people. It comes from not being secure in myself and not looking at the things within I have to fix. Sometimes you keep going because you don't want to face the truth.
Quotes.author: Naomi Campbell

Quotes.quote: The truth is, somebody is always talking about you, so you have to let it go... if it's not a part of your God-given destiny.
Quotes.author: Joel Osteen

Quotes.quote: We are volcanoes. When we women offer our experience as our truth, as human truth, all the maps change. There are new mountains.
Quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quotes.quote: If we bring not the good courage of minds covetous of truth, and truth only, prepared to hear all things, and decide upon all things, according to evidence, we should do more wisely to sit down contented in ignorance, than to bestir ourselves only to reap disappointment.
Quotes.author: Frances Wright

Quotes.quote: I have discovered the art of deceiving diplomats. I tell them the truth and they never believe me.
Quotes.author: Camillo di Cavour

Quotes.quote: My people are going to learn the principles of democracy, the dictates of truth and the teachings of science. Superstition must go.
Quotes.author: Mustafa Kemal Ataturk

Quotes.quote: There is risk and truth to yourselves and the world before you.
Quotes.author: Seamus Heaney

Quotes.quote: I've led a school whose faculty and students examine and discuss and debate every aspect of our law and legal system. And what I've learned most is that no one has a monopoly on truth or wisdom. I've learned that we make progress by listening to each other, across every apparent political or ideological divide.
Quotes.author: Elena Kagan

Quotes.quote: I guess I'm pretty much of a lone wolf. I don't say I don't like people at all, but, to tell you the truth, I only like it then if I have a chance to look deep into their hearts and their minds.
Quotes.author: Bela Lugosi

Quotes.quote: The essential truth is that sometimes you're worried that they'll find out it's a fluke, that you don't really have it. You've lost the muse or - the worst dread - you never had it at all. I went through all that madness early on.
Quotes.author: Robin Williams

Quotes.quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the heart's affections, and the truth of imagination.
Quotes.author: John Keats

Quotes.quote: Given the scale of trauma caused by the genocide, Rwanda has indicated that however thin the hope of a community can be, a hero always emerges. Although no one can dare claim that it is now a perfect state, and that no more work is needed, Rwanda has risen from the ashes as a model or truth and reconciliation.
Quotes.author: Wole Soyinka

Quotes.quote: The truth is that men are tired of liberty.
Quotes.author: Benito Mussolini

Quotes.quote: The truth is the Super Bowl long ago became more than just a football game. It's part of our culture like turkey at Thanksgiving and lights at Christmas, and like those holidays beyond their meaning, a factor in our economy.
Quotes.author: Bob Schieffer

Quotes.quote: Everyone with a cell phone thinks they're a photographer. Everyone with a laptop thinks they're a journalist. But they have no training, and they have no idea of what we keep to in terms of standards, as in what's far out and what's reality. And they have no dedication to truth.
Quotes.author: Helen Thomas

Quotes.quote: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.
Quotes.author: Charles Darwin

Quotes.quote: We occasionally stumble over the truth but most of us pick ourselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
Quotes.author: Winston Churchill

Quotes.quote: I know how easy it is for one to stay well within moral, ethical, and legal bounds through the skillful use of words - and to thereby spin, sidestep, circumvent, or bend a truth completely out of shape. To that extent, we are all liars on numerous occasions.
Quotes.author: Sidney Poitier

Quotes.quote: Wine comes in at the mouth And love comes in at the eye; That's all we shall know for truth Before we grow old and die.
Quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

Quotes.quote: What I've found - and the older I get, the more I understand this and stand behind it - is, my whole life has been an exploration of telling the truth. It's scary to be truthful, and it's scary to reveal yourself, and I'm very attracted to doing things that scare me.
Quotes.author: Jane Wiedlin

Quotes.quote: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger; give, if thou art asked for little; by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.
Quotes.author: Confucius

Quotes.quote: We are not afraid to entrust the American people with unpleasant facts, foreign ideas, alien philosophies, and competitive values. For a nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
Quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

Quotes.quote: I seek truth over a lie; I seek justice over injustice; I seek righteousness over the rewards of evildoers, and I love Allah more than I love the state.
Quotes.author: H. Rap Brown

Quotes.quote: Only the dreamer shall understand realities, though in truth his dreaming must be not out of proportion to his waking.
Quotes.author: Margaret Fuller

Quotes.quote: To me a real patriot is like a real friend. Who's your real friend? It's the person who tells you the truth. That's who my real friends are. So, you know, I think as far as our country goes, we need more people who will do that.
Quotes.author: Bill Maher

Quotes.quote: I am saddened by how people treat one another and how we are so shut off from one another and how we judge one another, when the truth is, we are all one connected thing. We are all from the same exact molecules.
Quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quotes.quote: Matangi's mantra is aim, which is MIA backwards. She fights for freedom of speech and stands for truth, and lives in the ghetto because her dad was the first person in Hindu mythology who came from the 'hood, but had gained enlightenment through not being a Brahmin.
Quotes.author: M.I.A.

Quotes.quote: Truth that is not undergirded by love makes the truth obnoxious and the possessor of it repulsive.
Quotes.author: Ravi Zacharias

Quotes.quote: We were talking about the space between us all and the people who hide themselves behind a wall of illusion. Never glimpse the truth - then it's far too late when they pass away.
Quotes.author: George Harrison

Quotes.quote: Why would anyone lie? The truth is always more colorful.
Quotes.author: James Hall

Quotes.quote: By and large, language is a tool for concealing the truth.
Quotes.author: George Carlin

Quotes.quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
Quotes.author: Flannery O'Connor

Quotes.quote: A lot of country music is sad. I think most art comes out of poverty and hard times. It applies to music. Three chords and the truth - that's what a country song is. There is a lot of heartache in the world.
Quotes.author: Willie Nelson

Quotes.quote: We must take positions. Our weakness in the West is born of the fact of so-called 'objectivity.' Objectivity does not exist - it cannot exist!... The word is a hypocrisy which is sustained by the lie that the truth stays in the middle. No, sir: Sometimes truth stays on one side only.
Quotes.author: Oriana Fallaci

Quotes.quote: I feel like my mission is to be honest with myself. My mission is to share my truth - share, not give. I think that's what an artist is supposed to do: I think they share.
Quotes.author: Gerard Way

Quotes.quote: There are sadistic scientists who hurry to hunt down errors instead of establishing the truth.
Quotes.author: Marie Curie

Quotes.quote: The said truth is that it is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong.
Quotes.author: Jeremy Bentham

Quotes.quote: Truth is the torch that gleams through the fog without dispelling it.
Quotes.author: Claude Adrien Helvetius

Quotes.quote: So far as hypotheses are concerned, let no one expect anything certain from astronomy, which cannot furnish it, lest he accept as the truth ideas conceived for another purpose, and depart from this study a greater fool than when he entered it.
Quotes.author: Nicolaus Copernicus

Quotes.quote: People think SEALs are cold-blooded, heartless, wound-up, brainwashed killers. They imagine you can just point a SEAL in a direction and say, 'Go kill.' The truth is you're talking about a bunch of kind-hearted, jovial guys. The only thing that separates them is mental toughness.
Quotes.author: Howard E. Wasdin

Quotes.quote: When virtue is lost, benevolence appears, when benevolence is lost right conduct appears, when right conduct is lost, expedience appears. Expediency is the mere shadow of right and truth; it is the beginning of disorder.
Quotes.author: Lao Tzu

Quotes.quote: There really can be no peace without justice. There can be no justice without truth. And there can be no truth, unless someone rises up to tell you the truth.
Quotes.author: Louis Farrakhan

Quotes.quote: A new scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die, and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.
Quotes.author: Max Planck

Quotes.quote: You're not going to be liked by everybody when you speak the truth. I don't speak the truth to put people down; I don't speak the truth to show disrespect.
Quotes.author: Hope Solo

Quotes.quote: But in truth, should I meet with gold or spices in great quantity, I shall remain till I collect as much as possible, and for this purpose I am proceeding solely in quest of them.
Quotes.author: Christopher Columbus

Quotes.quote: One may preach a covenant of grace more clearly than another... But when they preach a covenant of works for salvation, that is not truth.
Quotes.author: Anne Hutchinson

Quotes.quote: Once you go inside and weed through the muck, you will find the real beauty, the truth about yourself.
Quotes.author: Lindsay Wagner

Quotes.quote: The two things I understand best are stand-up comedy and martial arts. And those things require an ultimate grasp of the truth. You have to be objective about your skills and abilities to compete in both.
Quotes.author: Joe Rogan

Quotes.quote: I get some of my ideas from watching my three daughters, but most of them come from my own memories of growing up. I can remember how romantic I was, not just about love, but romance in the classic sense - the romantic ideals: of honor and truth, of loyalty, sacrifice and fairness. Those were the elements that made a story satisfying to me.
Quotes.author: Francine Pascal

Quotes.quote: The key to wisdom is this - constant and frequent questioning, for by doubting we are led to question and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
Quotes.author: Peter Abelard

Quotes.quote: If you're going to tell people the truth, be funny or they'll kill you.
Quotes.author: Billy Wilder

Quotes.quote: When one is frightened of the truth then it is never the whole truth that one has an inkling of.
Quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

Quotes.quote: Truth is the silliest thing under the sun. Try to get a living by the Truth and go to the Soup Societies. Heavens! Let any clergyman try to preach the Truth from its very stronghold, the pulpit, and they would ride him out of his church on his own pulpit bannister.
Quotes.author: Herman Melville

Quotes.quote: All photographs are accurate. None of them is the truth.
Quotes.author: Richard Avedon

Quotes.quote: The oppressed peoples can liberate themselves only through struggle. This is a simple and clear truth confirmed by history.
Quotes.author: Kim Il-sung

Quotes.quote: It is the truth of grace and not of the law that brings you true freedom. The truth of the law only binds you. In fact, religious bondage is one of the most crippling bondages with which a person can be encumbered. Religious bondage keeps one in constant fear, guilt, and anxiety.
Quotes.author: Joseph Prince

Quotes.quote: If you accept that people are the products of evolution, then you have to have an open mind to the truth. Unfair discrimination exists whether we like it or not; I wouldn't have married a gum-chewing vegetarian.
Quotes.author: James D. Watson

Quotes.quote: Education is not just about going to school and getting a degree. It's about widening your knowledge and absorbing the truth about life.
Quotes.author: Shakuntala Devi

Quotes.quote: I think a lot of people mistake my confidence on stage for cockiness in real life, and that's actually farthest from the truth. When I'm on stage, I'm that confident and that cocky because I have a microphone in my hand, and there's a few thousand people staring at me. And I know they're there to laugh.
Quotes.author: Russell Peters

Quotes.quote: Art is not a study of positive reality, it is the seeking for ideal truth.
Quotes.author: John Ruskin

Quotes.quote: Tell the truth. Sing with passion. Work with laughter. Love with heart. 'Cause that's all that matters in the end.
Quotes.author: Kris Kristofferson

Quotes.quote: When truth has no burning, then it is philosophy, when it gets burning from the heart, it becomes poetry.
Quotes.author: Muhammad Iqbal

Quotes.quote: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.
Quotes.author: John Keats

Quotes.quote: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.
Quotes.author: Anne Lamott

Quotes.quote: Language is the house of the truth of Being.
Quotes.author: Martin Heidegger

Quotes.quote: In every truth, the beneficiaries of a system cannot be expected to destroy it.
Quotes.author: A. Philip Randolph

Quotes.quote: Truth is a point of view, but authenticity can't be faked.
Quotes.author: Peter Guber

Quotes.quote: What is the difference between unethical and ethical advertising? Unethical advertising uses falsehoods to deceive the public; ethical advertising uses truth to deceive the public.
Quotes.author: Vilhjalmur Stefansson

Quotes.quote: Truth can be stated in a thousand different ways, yet each one can be true.
Quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

Quotes.quote: The great enemy of the truth is very often not the lie, deliberate, contrived and dishonest, but the myth, persistent, persuasive and unrealistic.
Quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

Quotes.quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
Quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quotes.quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
Quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quotes.quote: A lot of truth is said in jest.
Quotes.author: Eminem

Quotes.quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
Quotes.author: Rene Descartes

Quotes.quote: If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair.
Quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

Quotes.quote: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.
Quotes.author: Albert Einstein

Quotes.quote: Betrayal is the only truth that sticks.
Quotes.author: Arthur Miller

Quotes.quote: Every truth has two sides; it is as well to look at both, before we commit ourselves to either.
Quotes.author: Aesop

Quotes.quote: Truth will ultimately prevail where there is pains to bring it to light.
Quotes.author: George Washington

Quotes.quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
Quotes.author: Winston Churchill

Quotes.quote: We swallow greedily any lie that flatters us, but we sip only little by little at a truth we find bitter.
Quotes.author: Denis Diderot

Quotes.quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
Quotes.author: Walt Whitman

Quotes.quote: Even if you are a minority of one, the truth is the truth.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: Once you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains, no matter how improbable, must be the truth.
Quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quotes.quote: If I'd written all the truth I knew for the past ten years, about 600 people - including me - would be rotting in prison cells from Rio to Seattle today. Absolute truth is a very rare and dangerous commodity in the context of professional journalism.
Quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quotes.quote: There are some people so addicted to exaggeration that they can't tell the truth without lying.
Quotes.author: Josh Billings

Quotes.quote: Truth, like gold, is to be obtained not by its growth, but by washing away from it all that is not gold.
Quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

Quotes.quote: Experience has shown, and a true philosophy will always show, that a vast, perhaps the larger portion of the truth arises from the seemingly irrelevant.
Quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quotes.quote: A dog barks when his master is attacked. I would be a coward if I saw that God's truth is attacked and yet would remain silent.
Quotes.author: John Calvin

Quotes.quote: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
Quotes.author: W. Clement Stone

Quotes.quote: Truth exists; only lies are invented.
Quotes.author: Georges Braque

Quotes.quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
Quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes.quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
Quotes.author: John Keats

Quotes.quote: People are needed to take up the challenge, strong people, who proclaim the truth, throw it in people's faces, and do what they can with their own two hands.
Quotes.author: Abbe Pierre

Quotes.quote: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
Quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

Quotes.quote: Man will occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of the time he will pick himself up and continue on.
Quotes.author: Winston Churchill

Quotes.quote: I left in love, in laughter, and in truth, and wherever truth, love and laughter abide, I am there in spirit.
Quotes.author: Bill Hicks

Quotes.quote: This is my truth, tell me yours.
Quotes.author: Aneurin Bevan

Quotes.quote: The sole and basic source of our strength is the solidarity of workers, peasants and the intelligentsia, the solidarity of the nation, the solidarity of people who seek to live in dignity, truth, and in harmony with their conscience.
Quotes.author: Lech Walesa

Quotes.quote: To lovers of the truth, nothing can be put before God and hope in Him.
Quotes.author: Saint Basil

Quotes.quote: The harsh truth is, most red-haired men look like blondes who've spoiled from lack of refrigeration. They look like brown-haired men who've been composted out behind the barn. Yet that same pigmentation that on a man can resemble leaf mold or junkyard rust, a woman wears like a tiara of rubies.
Quotes.author: Tom Robbins

Quotes.quote: Thank you... 'Real Housewives of Atlanta,' for demonstrating a universal truth: Idiots like me will always watch idiots like you fight on TV. You will forever be in my TiVo.
Quotes.author: Jimmy Fallon

Quotes.quote: Truth is a thing immortal and perpetual, and it gives to us a beauty that fades not away in time.
Quotes.author: Frank Norris

Quotes.quote: I don't bill myself as an atheist but as a naturalist. Naturalism is a belief system. A lot of scientists bristle at that. We all have to believe we can find the truth. Evidence is my guide. I rely on observation, experimentation and verification.
Quotes.author: Greg Graffin

Quotes.quote: The truth is nobody can own anything. That was an unheard-of concept among indigenous people. We invented that.
Quotes.author: Tom Shadyac

Quotes.quote: It is claimed, but with what truth we cannot say, that there is a well-defined propaganda among the aliens of colour to bring about the degeneration of the white race.
Quotes.author: Emily Murphy

Quotes.quote: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.
Quotes.author: Winston Churchill

Quotes.quote: The pursuit of truth does not permit violence on one's opponent.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.'
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
Quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quotes.quote: I was sure I'd set the world on fire, and it was hard for a young feller like me to realize the truth - that I hadn't set the world on fire, and I was totally unprepared to handle the consequences if 'The Big Trail' had been a success and launched me as a star.
Quotes.author: John Wayne

Quotes.quote: In order to properly understand the big picture, everyone should fear becoming mentally clouded and obsessed with one small section of truth.
Quotes.author: Xun Zi

Quotes.quote: Myths and creeds are heroic struggles to comprehend the truth in the world.
Quotes.author: Ansel Adams

Quotes.quote: You must accept the truth from whatever source it comes.
Quotes.author: Maimonides

Quotes.quote: Humor is always based on a modicum of truth. Have you ever heard a joke about a father-in-law?
Quotes.author: Dick Clark

Quotes.quote: I've never really been one to try to be politically correct. I just feel truth is truth, and sometimes I probably offend some people.
Quotes.author: Franklin Graham

Quotes.quote: The truth is that we were born to have it all. And part of our handicap as adults is that we no longer understand our potential.
Quotes.author: Yehuda Berg

Quotes.quote: A testimony of the truth of the gospel does not come the same way to all people. Some receive it in a unique, life-changing experience. Others gain a testimony slowly, almost imperceptibly until, one day, they simply know.
Quotes.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

Quotes.quote: Have you heard of this new thing called the internet? It's giving people new expectations. It's allowing them to become their own expert. Knowledge lies anxious at their fingertips. Gloss over the truth in your advertising and you'll quickly be dismissed as a poser.
Quotes.author: Roy H. Williams

Quotes.quote: All of us create our own versions of an event, of our lives, even, not because we're liars, necessarily, but because we can only see and understand the truth from our own viewpoint, and a shifting viewpoint at that.
Quotes.author: Deb Caletti

Quotes.quote: The truth is, I don't have any problem with journalists - I count some of them as friends - also some of my heroes are journalists, I'm a big fan of Robert Fisk - great people or crazy people who are prepared to stand up for what's right.
Quotes.author: Daniel Craig

Quotes.quote: The truth is I'm not actually an expert programmer! I really don't consider myself to be an expert at anything. For me, it's more about having a well-rounded and broad horizon. I think that's where a lot of the more interesting things come from - mashing up completely disparate aspects of life to create something new and original.
Quotes.author: Aaron Koblin

Quotes.quote: All the religions of the world, while they may differ in other respects, unitedly proclaim that nothing lives in this world but Truth.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: One may sometimes tell a lie, but the grimace that accompanies it tells the truth.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.
Quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

Quotes.quote: Truth is the daughter of time, not of authority.
Quotes.author: Francis Bacon

Quotes.quote: Truth is a good dog; but always beware of barking too close to the heels of an error, lest you get your brains kicked out.
Quotes.author: Francis Bacon

Quotes.quote: Some taxpayers may object to a print journalism bailout on the grounds that it mostly benefits the liberal elite. And we can't blame taxpayers for being reluctant to subsidize the reportorial careers of J-school twerps who should have joined the Peace Corps and gone to Africa to 'speak truth to power' to Robert Mugabe.
Quotes.author: P. J. O'Rourke

Quotes.quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
Quotes.author: Andre Gide

Quotes.quote: The great advantage about telling the truth is that nobody ever believes it.
Quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

Quotes.quote: My dad raised me with some good advice: 'Always tell the truth. Always shoot from the hip. You might not have many friends, but you'll never have enemies, because people will always know where you're coming from.'
Quotes.author: Pink

Quotes.quote: But whether it be dream or truth, to do well is what matters. If it be truth, for truth's sake. If not, then to gain friends for the time when we awaken.
Quotes.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

Quotes.quote: Time is the father of truth, its mother is our mind.
Quotes.author: Giordano Bruno

Quotes.quote: Official history is merely a veil to hide the truth of what really happened. When the veil is lifted, again and again we see that not only is the official version not true, it is often 100% wrong.
Quotes.author: David Icke

Quotes.quote: The scientist is motivated primarily by curiosity and a desire for truth.
Quotes.author: Irving Langmuir

Quotes.quote: The usefulness of religion - the fact that it gives life meaning, that it makes people feel good - is not an argument for the truth of any religious doctrine. It's not an argument that it's reasonable to believe that Jesus really was born of a virgin or that the Bible is the perfect word of the creator of the universe.
Quotes.author: Sam Harris

Quotes.quote: No human being will ever know the Truth, for even if they happen to say it by chance, they would not even known they had done so.
Quotes.author: Xenophanes

Quotes.quote: I think he had a strange, passionate devotion to the truth and a horror at what he saw going on.
Quotes.author: Ben Bradlee

Quotes.quote: Why do you think the fans like us - why they prefer our street raps over all that phony stuff out there? Because we're telling the real story of what it's like living in places like Compton. We're giving them reality. We're like reporters. We give them the truth.
Quotes.author: Eazy-E

Quotes.quote: For me, exploration is about that journey to the interior, into your own heart. I'm always wondering, how will I act at my moment of truth? Will I rise up and do what's right, even if every fiber of my being is telling me otherwise?
Quotes.author: Ann Bancroft

Quotes.quote: I don't think Bosnia is ready for reconciliation, but I do think it is ready for truth.
Quotes.author: Paddy Ashdown

Quotes.quote: People like to cherry-pick the parts of their career that they're either in the midst of or that they're the most proud of, but the truth is careers and lives are tapestries.
Quotes.author: Mike Rowe

Quotes.quote: Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities. Truth isn't.
Quotes.author: Mark Twain

Quotes.quote: We often want one thing and pray for another, not telling the truth even to the gods.
Quotes.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quotes.quote: Not being known doesn't stop the truth from being true.
Quotes.author: Richard Bach

Quotes.quote: That which you create in beauty and goodness and truth lives on for all time to come. Don't spend your life accumulating material objects that will only turn to dust and ashes.
Quotes.author: Denis Waitley

Quotes.quote: As long as I tell the truth I feel that nobody can touch me.
Quotes.author: Henry Rollins

Quotes.quote: I speak the truth not so much as I would, but as much as I dare, and I dare a little more as I grow older.
Quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

Quotes.quote: Even the most cynical can hardly be surprised by the antics of Nixon and his accomplices as they are gradually revealed. It matters little, at this point, where the exact truth lies in the maze of perjury, evasion, and of contempt for the normal - hardly inspiring - standards of political conduct.
Quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

Quotes.quote: Justice is truth in action.
Quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quotes.quote: It is only a man's own fundamental thoughts that have truth and life in them. For it is these that he really and completely understands. To read the thoughts of others is like taking the remains of someone else's meal, like putting on the discarded clothes of a stranger.
Quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quotes.quote: A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth or perfection is a poverty-stricken day; and a succession of such days is fatal to human life.
Quotes.author: Lewis Mumford

Quotes.quote: Chase after the truth like all hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat tails.
Quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

Quotes.quote: Comedy has to be based on truth. You take the truth and you put a little curlicue at the end.
Quotes.author: Sid Caesar

Quotes.quote: Most people don't care if you're telling them the truth or if you're telling them a lie, as long as they're entertained by it.
Quotes.author: Tom Waits

Quotes.quote: Truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is.
Quotes.author: Nadine Gordimer

Quotes.quote: No matter how difficult and painful it may be, nothing sounds as good to the soul as the truth.
Quotes.author: Martha Beck

Quotes.quote: It does not require great learning to be a Christian and be convinced of the truth of the Bible. It requires only an honest heart and a willingness to obey God.
Quotes.author: Albert Barnes

Quotes.quote: It is a clear truth that those who every day barter away other men's liberty will soon care little for their own.
Quotes.author: James Otis

Quotes.quote: If you tell the truth about how you're feeling, it becomes funny.
Quotes.author: Larry David

Quotes.quote: If the individual, or heretic, gets hold of some essential truth, or sees some error in the system being practiced, he commits so many marginal errors himself that he is worn out before he can establish his point.
Quotes.author: Ezra Pound

Quotes.quote: Country music is three chords and the truth.
Quotes.author: Harlan Howard

Quotes.quote: It is a great mystery that though the human heart longs for Truth, in which alone it finds liberation and delight, the first reaction of human beings to Truth is one of hostility and fear!
Quotes.author: Anthony de Mello

Quotes.quote: The remedy for speech that is false is speech that is true. This is the ordinary course in a free society. The response to the unreasoned is the rational; to the uninformed, the enlightened; to the straight-out lie, the simple truth.
Quotes.author: Anthony Kennedy

Quotes.quote: I think heterosexuality and homosexuality are a kind of psychosis, and the truth is somewhere in the middle.
Quotes.author: Jeanette Winterson

Quotes.quote: When there are multiple versions of a story, you really have three ways to go. You can pick the most sensational version. You can try to balance things in your gut to get to what you think is the honest truth. Or you can err on the side of kindness.
Quotes.author: Walter Isaacson

Quotes.quote: The truth is my love life has been a lot more turbulent than I have let on.
Quotes.author: George Michael

Quotes.quote: I feel like it's my responsibility and my obligation to stand up and to say that which I believe to be the truth.
Quotes.author: Jimmy Swaggart

Quotes.quote: It takes a long time to learn that a courtroom is the last place in the world for learning the truth.
Quotes.author: Alice Koller

Quotes.quote: Marriage, if one will face the truth, is an evil, but a necessary evil.
Quotes.author: Menander

Quotes.quote: Being a leader for me is about having the courage to speak the truth, and live the truth, despite attempts to silence our thoughts, feelings, and past experiences.
Quotes.author: Zainab Salbi

Quotes.quote: The end of confession is to tell the truth to and for oneself.
Quotes.author: J. M. Coetzee

Quotes.quote: If readers, young and old, would take even a moment to reflect on our rapidly shifting culture and ideology, I would be happy. Many leaders of the older generation dismiss emerging culture. Those leaders are at risk of becoming a feeble voice-piece without followers. Most of the younger generation is going deaf to the truth.
Quotes.author: Ted Dekker

Quotes.quote: Let us rise in the moral power of womanhood; and give utterance to the voice of outraged mercy, and insulted justice, and eternal truth, and mighty love and holy freedom.
Quotes.author: Maria Weston Chapman

Quotes.quote: I'll continue to try and balance like a circus act. And I will just fight to always tell the truth. Even if it's difficult.
Quotes.author: Katy Perry

Quotes.quote: Government has never increased the standard of living of one single human being in civilization's history. For some reason that simple truth has evaded everybody.
Quotes.author: Steve Wynn

Quotes.quote: Truth never yet fell dead in the streets; it has such affinity with the soul of man, the seed however broadcast will catch somewhere and produce its hundredfold.
Quotes.author: Theodore Parker

Quotes.quote: People always love and respect characters who speak the truth, even if the truth hurts.
Quotes.author: David Duchovny

Quotes.quote: I would rather the man who presents something for my consideration subject me to a zephyr of truth and a gentle breeze of responsibility rather than blow me down with a curtain of hot wind.
Quotes.author: Grover Cleveland

Quotes.quote: The truth is that killing innocent people is always wrong - and no argument or excuse, no matter how deeply believed, can ever make it right. No religion on earth condones the killing of innocent people; no faith tradition tolerates the random killing of our brothers and sisters on this earth.
Quotes.author: Feisal Abdul Rauf

Quotes.quote: Christlike communications are expressions of affection and not anger, truth and not fabrication, compassion and not contention, respect and not ridicule, counsel and not criticism, correction and not condemnation. They are spoken with clarity and not with confusion. They may be tender or they may be tough, but they must always be tempered.
Quotes.author: L. Lionel Kendrick

Quotes.quote: An example I often use to illustrate the reality of vanity, is this: look at the peacock; it's beautiful if you look at it from the front. But if you look at it from behind, you discover the truth... Whoever gives in to such self-absorbed vanity has huge misery hiding inside them.
Quotes.author: Pope Francis

Quotes.quote: The thing about black history is that the truth is so much more complex than anything you could make up.
Quotes.author: Henry Louis Gates

Quotes.quote: My religion is based on truth and non-violence. Truth is my God. Non-violence is the means of realising Him.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: Happiness is spiritual, born of truth and love. It is unselfish; therefore it cannot exist alone, but requires all mankind to share it.
Quotes.author: Mary Baker Eddy

Quotes.quote: The bud of victory is always in the truth.
Quotes.author: Benjamin Harrison

Quotes.quote: Non-violence and truth are inseparable and presuppose one another.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: Strike an average between what a woman thinks of her husband a month before she marries him and what she thinks of him a year afterward, and you will have the truth about him.
Quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

Quotes.quote: That which is false troubles the heart, but truth brings joyous tranquillity.
Quotes.author: Rumi

Quotes.quote: Science moves with the spirit of an adventure characterized both by youthful arrogance and by the belief that the truth, once found, would be simple as well as pretty.
Quotes.author: James D. Watson

Quotes.quote: They say death and taxes are the only things that are inevitable. The truth is, you can not pay your taxes. I've done it, and there's consequences, but it can be done. Death you're not going to get out of, and you kind of got to deal with it.
Quotes.author: Steve Earle

Quotes.quote: The greatest truth is honesty, and the greatest falsehood is dishonesty.
Quotes.author: Abu Bakr

Quotes.quote: Pain reaches the heart with electrical speed, but truth moves to the heart as slowly as a glacier.
Quotes.author: Barbara Kingsolver

Quotes.quote: We too often bind ourselves by authorities rather than by the truth.
Quotes.author: Lucretia Mott

Quotes.quote: The first step toward finding God, Who is Truth, is to discover the truth about myself: and if I have been in error, this first step to truth is the discovery of my error.
Quotes.author: Thomas Merton

Quotes.quote: When we believe in lies, we cannot see the truth, so we make thousands of assumptions and we take them as truth. One of the biggest assumptions we make is that the lies we believe are the truth!
Quotes.author: Miguel Angel Ruiz

Quotes.quote: There's just some magic in truth and honesty and openness.
Quotes.author: Frank Ocean

Quotes.quote: I perceived how that it was impossible to establish the lay people in any truth except the Scripture were plainly laid before their eyes in their mother tongue.
Quotes.author: William Tyndale

Quotes.quote: If you're thinking of coming to America, this is what it's like: you've got your Comfort Inn, you've got your Best Western, and you've got your Red Lobster where you eat. Everybody's very fat, everybody's very stupid and everybody's very rude - it's not a holiday programme, it's the truth.
Quotes.author: Jeremy Clarkson

Quotes.quote: During a large disaster, like Hurricane Katrina, warnings get hopelessly jumbled. The truth is that, for warnings to work, it's not enough for them to be delivered. They must also overcome that human tendency to pause; they must trigger a series of effective actions, mobilizing the informal networks that we depend on in a crisis.
Quotes.author: Gary Wolf

Quotes.quote: I am sorry to think that you do not get a man's most effective criticism until you provoke him. Severe truth is expressed with some bitterness.
Quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes.quote: It's a deep and all but certain truth about narcissistic personalities that to meet them is to love them, but to know them well is to find them unbearable. Confidence quickly curdles into arrogance; smarts turn to smugness, charm turns to smarm.
Quotes.author: Jeffrey Kluger

Quotes.quote: Humans believe so many lies because we aren't aware. We ignore the truth or we just don't see the truth. When we are educated, we accumulate a lot of knowledge, and all that knowledge is just like a wall of fog that doesn't allow us to perceive the truth, what really is.
Quotes.author: Miguel Angel Ruiz

Quotes.quote: Competence, like truth, beauty, and contact lenses, is in the eye of the beholder.
Quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

Quotes.quote: Photography is truth. The cinema is truth twenty-four times per second.
Quotes.author: Jean-Luc Godard

Quotes.quote: If there is no criticism, you become lazy. But it should be constructive, and it should be the truth. If it's biased and there's no truth in it, then I don't care about it. If it's true, it helps me grow.
Quotes.author: A. R. Rahman

Quotes.quote: When I tell the truth, it is not for the sake of convincing those who do not know it, but for the sake of defending those that do.
Quotes.author: William Blake

Quotes.quote: Seldom, very seldom, does complete truth belong to any human disclosure; seldom can it happen that something is not a little disguised, or a little mistaken.
Quotes.author: Jane Austen

Quotes.quote: Everyone who knows me will know the truth, which is that my children come first in my life and that I would never harm any child.
Quotes.author: Michael Jackson

Quotes.quote: It is by doubting that we come to investigate, and by investigating that we recognize the truth.
Quotes.author: Peter Abelard

Quotes.quote: If Christians will obey the instructions given to them by Christ and his inspired apostles, they will adorn the religion of the Bible, and save themselves much perplexity and severe trials, which they attribute to their afflictions in consequence of believing unpopular truth.
Quotes.author: Ellen G. White

Quotes.quote: Truth in philosophy means that concept and external reality correspond.
Quotes.author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

Quotes.quote: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.
Quotes.author: Walter Benjamin

Quotes.quote: Even the acceptance of personal responsibility may not overcome the temptation to believe that now is not the time to repent. 'Now' can seem so difficult, and 'later' appear so much easier. The truth is that today is always a better day to repent than any tomorrow.
Quotes.author: Henry B. Eyring

Quotes.quote: The whole point of the kingdom of God is Jesus has come to bear witness to the true truth, which is nonviolent. When God wants to take charge of the world, he doesn't send in the tanks. He sends in the poor and the meek.
Quotes.author: N. T. Wright

Quotes.quote: We cannot forever hide the truth about ourselves, from ourselves.
Quotes.author: John McCain

Quotes.quote: Time is money says the proverb, but turn it around and you get a precious truth. Money is time.
Quotes.author: George Gissing

Quotes.quote: Remember the sufferings of Christ, the storms that were weathered... the crown that came from those sufferings which gave new radiance to the faith... All saints give testimony to the truth that without real effort, no one ever wins the crown.
Quotes.author: Thomas Becket

Quotes.quote: The People have a right to the Truth as they have a right to life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.
Quotes.author: Frank Norris

Quotes.quote: Piety requires us to honor truth above our friends.
Quotes.author: Aristotle

Quotes.quote: Not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, does the enlightened man dislike to wade into its waters.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: It takes two to speak the truth: one to speak, and another to hear.
Quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes.quote: If truth is beauty, how come no one has their hair done in the library?
Quotes.author: Lily Tomlin

Quotes.quote: When people talk, they lay lines on each other, do a lot of role playing, sidestep, shilly-shally and engage in all manner of vagueness and innuendo. We do this and expect others to do it, yet at the same time we profess to long for the plain truth, for people to say what they mean, simple as that. Such hypocrisy is a human universal.
Quotes.author: Steven Pinker

Quotes.quote: One must be very particular about telling the truth. Through truth one can realize God.
Quotes.author: Ramakrishna

Quotes.quote: To tell the truth is to become beautiful, to begin to love yourself, value yourself. And that's political, in its most profound way.
Quotes.author: June Jordan

Quotes.quote: It is proof of a base and low mind for one to wish to think with the masses or majority, merely because the majority is the majority. Truth does not change because it is, or is not, believed by a majority of the people.
Quotes.author: Giordano Bruno

Quotes.quote: The lowest form of popular culture - lack of information, misinformation, disinformation, and a contempt for the truth or the reality of most people's lives - has overrun real journalism. Today, ordinary Americans are being stuffed with garbage.
Quotes.author: Carl Bernstein

Quotes.quote: Only when we realize that there is no eternal, unchanging truth or absolute truth can we arouse in ourselves a sense of intellectual responsibility.
Quotes.author: Hu Shih

Quotes.quote: Who is God? Who are we? What is our purpose? All these questions remain unanswered. I want to reach the genuine seeker of spiritual well-being. My goal is to satisfy the hunger and longing for those who are seeking the truth.
Quotes.author: Ravi Zacharias

Quotes.quote: The truth is that entrepreneurship is more like a roller coaster ride than a cruise.
Quotes.author: Vivek Wadhwa

Quotes.quote: There can be no democracy without truth. There can be no truth without controversy, there can be no change without freedom. Without freedom there can be no progress.
Quotes.author: Andrew Young

Quotes.quote: I'm looking for the truth. The audience doesn't come to see you, they come to see themselves.
Quotes.author: Julianne Moore

Quotes.quote: At its best, fiction cultivates fantasy and compassion; at its worst, memoir provokes schadenfreude and prurience. The ugly truth, I fear, is that many people are drawn to sensational memoirs for the same reason they watch 'The Apprentice': they like to witness actual suffering, before-your-very-eyes humiliation.
Quotes.author: Julia Glass

Quotes.quote: The object of the superior man is truth.
Quotes.author: Confucius

Quotes.quote: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
Quotes.author: Albert Camus

Quotes.quote: Only the broken-hearted know the truth about love.
Quotes.author: Mason Cooley

Quotes.quote: A lot of people are afraid to tell the truth, to say no. That's where toughness comes into play. Toughness is not being a bully. It's having backbone.
Quotes.author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quotes.quote: Any fool knows that bravado is always a cover-up for insecurity. That's the truth. And on that note, I'll say goodnight. God love you.
Quotes.author: Bobby Darin

Quotes.quote: Marilyn Monroe wasn't even her real name, Charles Manson isn't his real name, and now, I'm taking that to be my real name. But what's real? You can't find the truth, you just pick the lie you like the best.
Quotes.author: Marilyn Manson

Quotes.quote: I went into the business for the money, and the art grew out of it. If people are disillusioned by that remark, I can't help it. It's the truth.
Quotes.author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes.quote: Always speak the truth, think before you speak, and write it down afterwards.
Quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

Quotes.quote: President Barack Obama has stood watch over the greatest job loss in modern American history. And that, my friends, is one inconvenient truth that will haunt this President throughout history.
Quotes.author: Mitt Romney

Quotes.quote: I can prove anything by statistics except the truth.
Quotes.author: George Canning

Quotes.quote: Truth will rise above falsehood as oil above water.
Quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

Quotes.quote: The truth is, I often like women. I like their unconventionality. I like their completeness. I like their anonymity.
Quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes.quote: Real intimacy depends on truth - lovingly told - especially in the bedroom.
Quotes.author: Joyce Brothers

Quotes.quote: Elections, for their part, are typically popularity contests rather than measures of candidates' relative competency or effectiveness. Imagine if scientific truth were determined according to which scientist was most popular. To be successful, scientists would have to be charismatic and attractive - and human knowledge would suffer terribly.
Quotes.author: Nathan Myhrvold

Quotes.quote: I'm not a tough guy. I'm just delivering the truth and only the truth and if you can't deal with it, too bad.
Quotes.author: Kevin O'Leary

Quotes.quote: Now, today is the day we honor, of course, the Presidents, ranging from George Washington, who couldn't tell a lie, to George Bush, who couldn't tell the truth, to Bill Clinton, who couldn't tell the difference.
Quotes.author: Jay Leno

Quotes.quote: Telling the truth to people who misunderstand you is generally promoting a falsehood, isn't it?
Quotes.author: Anthony Hope

Quotes.quote: Art is nothing but the expression of our dream; the more we surrender to it the closer we get to the inner truth of things, our dream-life, the true life that scorns questions and does not see them.
Quotes.author: Franz Marc

Quotes.quote: There are no captions on red-carpet photos that say, 'This girl trained for two weeks, she went on a juice diet, she has a professional hair and makeup person, and this dress was made for her.' I just wish they'd say, 'It ain't the truth.'
Quotes.author: Emilia Clarke

Quotes.quote: I am a humble but very earnest seeker after truth.
Quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes.quote: In the consciousness of the truth he has perceived, man now sees everywhere only the awfulness or the absurdity of existence and loathing seizes him.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: Art is a lie that makes us realize truth.
Quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes.quote: No one can be happy who has been thrust outside the pale of truth. And there are two ways that one can be removed from this realm: by lying, or by being lied to.
Quotes.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quotes.quote: The truth is found when men are free to pursue it.
Quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quotes.quote: The very concept of objective truth is fading out of the world. Lies will pass into history.
Quotes.author: George Orwell

Quotes.quote: There is nothing so strong or safe in an emergency of life as the simple truth.
Quotes.author: Charles Dickens

Quotes.quote: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.
Quotes.author: Carl Jung

Quotes.quote: The truth is that life is delicious, horrible, charming, frightful, sweet, bitter, and that is everything.
Quotes.author: Anatole France

Quotes.quote: Getting rid of a delusion makes us wiser than getting hold of a truth.
Quotes.author: Ludwig Borne

Quotes.quote: If the truth contradicts deeply held beliefs, that is too bad.
Quotes.author: Hans Eysenck

Quotes.quote: You can hate me. You can go out there and say anything you want about me, But you will love me later because I told you the truth.
Quotes.author: Mary J. Blige

Quotes.quote: The color of truth is gray.
Quotes.author: Andre Gide

Quotes.quote: To have the truth in your possession you can be found guilty, sentenced to death.
Quotes.author: Peter Tosh

Quotes.quote: Truth springs from argument amongst friends.
Quotes.author: David Hume

Quotes.quote: The Bible must be considered as the great source of all the truth by which men are to be guided in government as well as in all social transactions.
Quotes.author: Noah Webster

Quotes.quote: The sad truth is that the civil rights movement cannot be reborn until we identify the causes of black suffering, some of them self-inflicted. Why can't black leaders organize rallies around responsible sexuality, birth within marriage, parents reading to their children and students staying in school and doing homework?
Quotes.author: Henry Louis Gates

Quotes.quote: Architecture is the reaching out for the truth.
Quotes.author: Louis Kahn

Quotes.quote: Mom spent the time that she was supposed to be a kid actully raising children, her younger brother and younger sister. She was tough as nails and did not suffer fools at all. And the truth was she could not afford to. She spoke the truth, bluntly, directly, and without much varnish. I am her son.
Quotes.author: Chris Christie

Quotes.quote: When a scientist is ahead of his times, it is often through misunderstanding of current, rather than intuition of future truth. In science there is never any error so gross that it won't one day, from some perspective, appear prophetic.
Quotes.author: Jean Rostand

Quotes.quote: Both need each other: The agnostic cannot be content to not know, but must be in search of the great truth of faith; the Catholic cannot be content to have faith, but must be in search of God all the time, and in the dialogue with others, a Catholic can learn more about God in a deeper fashion.
Quotes.author: Pope Benedict XVI

Quotes.quote: Metaphors have a way of holding the most truth in the least space.
Quotes.author: Orson Scott Card

Quotes.quote: It is not the truth that a man possesses, or believes that he possesses, but the earnest effort which he puts forward to reach the truth, which constitutes the worth of a man.
Quotes.author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

Quotes.quote: The earth is such a voluminous, sparse, wild place that has its own rhythm that human beings try to control and strategize our way around, but the truth is, if you're out someplace like the ocean on a capsized boat, it doesn't matter if you have academic degrees, or if you're a martial-arts ninja. Nature is a bigger force than you.
Quotes.author: Rachael Taylor

Quotes.quote: At a certain point, I felt the need to submit to a higher level of religiosity... to move away from my intuition and to accept an ultimate truth. I felt that in order to become a good person, I needed rules - lots of them - or else I would somehow fall apart. I am reclaiming myself. Trusting my goodness and my divine mission.
Quotes.author: Matisyahu

Quotes.quote: The pharmaceutical industry likes to depict itself as a research-based industry, as the source of innovative drugs. Nothing could be further from the truth. This is their incredible PR and their nerve.
Quotes.author: Marcia Angell

Quotes.quote: Mystical explanations are thought to be deep; the truth is that they are not even shallow.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: The truth is, in order to get things like universal health care and a revamped education system, then someone is going to have to give up a piece of their pie so that someone else can have more.
Quotes.author: Michelle Obama

Quotes.quote: It is error only, and not truth, that shrinks from inquiry.
Quotes.author: Thomas Paine

Quotes.quote: The truth is a snare: you cannot have it, without being caught. You cannot have the truth in such a way that you catch it, but only in such a way that it catches you.
Quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quotes.quote: We've used up a lot of bullets. And we talk about stimulus. But the truth is, we're running a federal deficit that's 9 percent of GDP. That is stimulative as all get out. It's more stimulative than any policy we've followed since World War II.
Quotes.author: Warren Buffett

Quotes.quote: Any truth is better than indefinite doubt.
Quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quotes.quote: He that takes truth for his guide, and duty for his end, may safely trust to God's providence to lead him aright.
Quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes.quote: Mental fight means thinking against the current, not with it. It is our business to puncture gas bags and discover the seeds of truth.
Quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes.quote: Doubt, indulged and cherished, is in danger of becoming denial; but if honest, and bent on thorough investigation, it may soon lead to full establishment of the truth.
Quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

Quotes.quote: There are only two things. Truth and lies. Truth is indivisible, hence it cannot recognize itself; anyone who wants to recognize it has to be a lie.
Quotes.author: Franz Kafka

Quotes.quote: It seems a fantastic paradox, but it is nevertheless a most important truth, that no architecture can be truly noble which is not imperfect.
Quotes.author: John Ruskin

Quotes.quote: There is not one single police officer in America that I am not afraid of and not one that I would trust to tell the truth or obey the laws they are sworn to uphold. I do not believe they protect me in any way.
Quotes.author: Henry Rollins

Quotes.quote: Do not love leisure. Waste not a minute. Be bold. Realize the Truth, here and now!
Quotes.author: Swami Sivananda

Quotes.quote: As a small businessperson, you have no greater leverage than the truth.
Quotes.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

Quotes.quote: Dispassionate objectivity is itself a passion, for the real and for the truth.
Quotes.author: Abraham Maslow

Quotes.quote: Bad taste is simply saying the truth before it should be said.
Quotes.author: Mel Brooks

Quotes.quote: I think 80 percent of the population are really great, caring people who will help you and tell you the truth. That's just the way it is. And I think 20 percent of the population are crooks and liars. It's just a fact.
Quotes.author: Tom Hanks

Quotes.quote: I've been & am absurdly over-estimated. There are no supermen & I'm quite ordinary, & will say so whatever the artistic results. In that point I'm one of the few people who tell the truth about myself.
Quotes.author: T. E. Lawrence

Quotes.quote: The truth is often a terrible weapon of aggression. It is possible to lie, and even to murder, with the truth.
Quotes.author: Alfred Adler

Quotes.quote: The poet is a liar who always speaks the truth.
Quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

Quotes.quote: Justice is rather the activity of truth, than a virtue in itself. Truth tells us what is due to others, and justice renders that due. Injustice is acting a lie.
Quotes.author: Horace Walpole

Quotes.quote: But now I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth.
Quotes.author: Umberto Eco

Quotes.quote: The truth is that since childhood I had cultivated an existential independence. It came from perceiving the adults around me as unreliable, and without it I felt I wouldn't have survived. I cared deeply for everyone in my family, but in the end I depended on myself.
Quotes.author: Sonia Sotomayor

Quotes.quote: The universal medicine for the Soul is the Supreme Reason and Absolute Justice; for the mind, mathematical and practical Truth; for the body, the Quintessence, a combination of light and gold.
Quotes.author: Albert Pike
