Quotes.quote: A memoir forces me to stop and remember carefully. It is an exercise in truth. In a memoir, I look at myself, my life, and the people I love the most in the mirror of the blank screen. In a memoir, feelings are more important than facts, and to write honestly, I have to confront my demons.
Quotes.author: Isabel Allende

Quotes.quote: I am aware that a philosopher's ideas are not subject to the judgment of ordinary persons, because it is his endeavour to seek the truth in all things, to the extent permitted to human reason by God.
Quotes.author: Nicolaus Copernicus

Quotes.quote: Everything will line up perfectly when knowing and living the truth becomes more important than looking good.
Quotes.author: Alan Cohen

Quotes.quote: The spirit of truth and the spirit of freedom - these are the pillars of society.
Quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen

Quotes.quote: These years in silence and reflection made me stronger and reminded me that acceptance has to come from within and that this kind of truth gives me the power to conquer emotions I didn't even know existed.
Quotes.author: Ricky Martin

Quotes.quote: The first casualty when war comes is truth.
Quotes.author: Hiram Johnson

Quotes.quote: The influence of 'Hidden Fortress' comes up a lot because it was printed in a book once. The truth is, the only thing I was inspired by was the fact that it's told from the point of view of two peasants, who get mixed up with a samurai and princess and a lot of very high-level people.
Quotes.author: George Lucas

Quotes.quote: Scientists search for truth. Philosophers search for morality. A criminal trial searches for only one result: proof beyond a reasonable doubt.
Quotes.author: Alan Dershowitz

Quotes.quote: The clearest actions come from truth, not obligation.
Quotes.author: Gerard Way

Quotes.quote: Everybody has a Big Momma: the mother or the grandmother who tells it like it is, keeps it real with them, isn't afraid to tell you the truth about yourself.
Quotes.author: Martin Lawrence

Quotes.quote: Leaders know the importance of having someone in their lives who will unfailingly and fearlessly tell them the truth.
Quotes.author: Warren Bennis

Quotes.quote: I like to joke that I probably hold the world record for rejection letters. Yes, the truth is that I was fed up of being rejected repeatedly, and self-publication was an act of defiance at traditional publishing. But life works in strange ways.
Quotes.author: Ashwin Sanghi

Quotes.quote: There is no teacher, living or past, who can give us the actual understanding of Truth. A teacher can only put our feet upon the path and point the way. That is all. It is wholly dependent on the individual to make his way to Truth.
Quotes.author: Paul Twitchell

Quotes.quote: I've worked for 55 years. I'm going to take a little time off, to tell you the truth. It's just that now in the last couple of weeks, Gelman is pouring it on. 'Farewell to Regis!' It's getting embarrassing.
Quotes.author: Regis Philbin

Quotes.quote: You never monkey with the truth.
Quotes.author: Ben Bradlee

Quotes.quote: Go to the truth beyond the mind. Love is the bridge.
Quotes.author: Stephen Levine

Quotes.quote: Barack Obama would not be President if he were dark skin. You know what I mean? That's just the truth. I might not be as successful as I am now if I was dark skin.
Quotes.author: J. Cole

Quotes.quote: You can't legislate into existence an act of forgiveness and a true confession; those are mysteries of the human heart, and they occur between one individual and another individual, not a panel of judges sitting asking questions, trying to test your truth.
Quotes.author: Athol Fugard

Quotes.quote: The intellectual power is never at rest; it is never satisfied with any comprehended truth, but ever proceeds on and on towards that truth which is not comprehended. So also the will, which follows the apprehension; we see that it is never satisfied with anything finite.
Quotes.author: Giordano Bruno

Quotes.quote: Pirates are the very essence of profit maximising entrepreneurs described in neoclassical economics. Yet, whilst films such as 'The Pirates of the Caribbean' and 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid' have gone a long way to popularise both pirates and outlaw behaviour, the truth of the matter is that piracy is illegal, and it kills.
Quotes.author: Peter Middlebrook

Quotes.quote: You cannot 'rationalize' what is not rational to begin with - as if lying were called 'truthization.' There is no way to obtain more truth for a proposition by bribery, flattery, or the most passionate argument - you can make more people believe the proposition, but you cannot make it more true.
Quotes.author: Eliezer Yudkowsky

Quotes.quote: Keep in mind that when public figures get in trouble for something they said, it is usually not because they misspoke, but because they accidentally told the truth.
Quotes.author: David Carr

Quotes.quote: Many a doctrine is like a window pane. We see truth through it but it divides us from truth.
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: In truth, politeness is artificial good humor, it covers the natural want of it, and ends by rendering habitual a substitute nearly equivalent to the real virtue.
Quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes.quote: The rarest quality in an epitaph is truth.
Quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes.quote: Truth is mysterious, elusive, always to be conquered. Liberty is dangerous, as hard to live with as it is elating. We must march toward these two goals, painfully but resolutely, certain in advance of our failings on so long a road.
Quotes.author: Albert Camus

Quotes.quote: The truth is, sex doesn't mean that much to me now.
Quotes.author: Lana Turner

Quotes.quote: If you shut the door to all errors, truth will be shut out.
Quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes.quote: Truth is weirder than any fiction I've seen.
Quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quotes.quote: First and last, what is demanded of genius is love of truth.
Quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes.quote: Opinions are made to be changed - or how is truth to be got at?
Quotes.author: Lord Byron

Quotes.quote: It was one of those evenings when men feel that truth, goodness and beauty are one. In the morning, when they commit their discovery to paper, when others read it written there, it looks wholly ridiculous.
Quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

Quotes.quote: It is a universal truth that the loss of liberty at home is to be charged to the provisions against danger, real or pretended, from abroad.
Quotes.author: James Madison

Quotes.quote: Everything deep is also simple and can be reproduced simply as long as its reference to the whole truth is maintained. But what matters is not what is witty but what is true.
Quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

Quotes.quote: When you're caught up in the storm or, you know, just the turmoil of everything that there is another side and you do get through it. And you know, just standing by the truth and doing the right thing.
Quotes.author: Amber Frey

Quotes.quote: Whoever is detected in a shameful fraud is ever after not believed even if they speak the truth.
Quotes.author: Phaedrus

Quotes.quote: For truth is always strange; stranger than fiction.
Quotes.author: Lord Byron

Quotes.quote: Truth is always strange, stranger than fiction.
Quotes.author: Lord Byron

Quotes.quote: Be calm in arguing; for fierceness makes error a fault, and truth discourtesy.
Quotes.author: George Herbert

Quotes.quote: Your problem is how you are going to spend this one odd and precious life you have been issued. Whether you're going to spend it trying to look good and creating the illusion that you have power over people and circumstances, or whether you are going to taste it, enjoy it and find out the truth about who you are.
Quotes.author: Anne Lamott

Quotes.quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
Quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes.quote: It is always the best policy to speak the truth, unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
Quotes.author: Jerome K. Jerome

Quotes.quote: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
Quotes.author: Bruce Lee

Quotes.quote: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure the truth.
Quotes.author: Maya Angelou

Quotes.quote: Light is the symbol of truth.
Quotes.author: James Russell Lowell

Quotes.quote: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.
Quotes.author: Mark Twain

Quotes.quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
Quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes.quote: I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant.
Quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quotes.quote: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself - an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly.
Quotes.author: Antisthenes

Quotes.quote: Hard times arouse an instinctive desire for authenticity.
Quotes.author: Coco Chanel

Quotes.quote: Facts are stubborn things.
Quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

Quotes.quote: When in doubt tell the truth.
Quotes.author: Mark Twain

Quotes.quote: Tell the truth, but tell it slant.
Quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

Quotes.quote: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.
Quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes.quote: Truth is a deep kindness that teaches us to be content in our everyday life and share with the people the same happiness.
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: A truth that's told with bad intent beats all the lies you can invent.
Quotes.author: William Blake

Quotes.quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
Quotes.author: Lord Byron

Quotes.quote: I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours.
Quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quotes.quote: Truth is strong, and sometime or other will prevail.
Quotes.author: Mary Astell

Quotes.quote: Fear is not in the habit of speaking truth; when perfect sincerity is expected, perfect freedom must be allowed; nor has anyone who is apt to be angry when he hears the truth any cause to wonder that he does not hear it.
Quotes.author: Tacitus

Quotes.quote: Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake.
Quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

Quotes.quote: Half a truth is often a great lie.
Quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes.quote: Reason is the natural order of truth; but imagination is the organ of meaning.
Quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

Quotes.quote: People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
Quotes.author: Andy Rooney

Quotes.quote: Three chords and the truth - that's what a country song is.
Quotes.author: Willie Nelson

Quotes.quote: I think there ought to be a club in which preachers and journalists could come together and have the sentimentalism of the one matched with the cynicism of the other. That ought to bring them pretty close to the truth.
Quotes.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

Quotes.quote: I pefer an ugly truth to a pretty lie. If someone is telling me the truth that is when I will give my heart.
Quotes.author: Shakira

Quotes.quote: The truth may be out there, but lies are inside your head.
Quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

Quotes.quote: When I saw corruption, I was forced to find truth on my own. I couldn't swallow the hypocrisy.
Quotes.author: Barry White

Quotes.quote: A rusty nail placed near a faithful compass, will sway it from the truth, and wreck the argosy.
Quotes.author: Walter Scott

Quotes.quote: Power is domination, control, and therefore a very selective form of truth which is a lie.
Quotes.author: Wole Soyinka

Quotes.quote: The man who cannot endure to have his errors and shortcomings brought to the surface and made known, but tries to hide them, is unfit to walk the highway of truth.
Quotes.author: James Allen

Quotes.quote: Young people are just as attracted to the truth as they are convenience and expediency.
Quotes.author: Pope Francis

Quotes.quote: We live in a world of denial, and we don't know what the truth is anymore.
Quotes.author: Javier Bardem

Quotes.quote: Most people live in a myth and grow violently angry if anyone dares to tell them the truth about themselves.
Quotes.author: Robert Anton Wilson

Quotes.quote: Truth is exact correspondence with reality.
Quotes.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

Quotes.quote: Let's not be afraid to speak the common sense truth: you can't have high standards without good discipline.
Quotes.author: William Hague

Quotes.quote: Myth and fairy-story must, as all art, reflect and contain in solution elements of moral and religious truth (or error), but not explicit, not in the known form of the primary 'real' world.
Quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

Quotes.quote: A lie would have no sense unless the truth were felt dangerous.
Quotes.author: Alfred Adler

Quotes.quote: Biggest lesson I learned my first year in the NFL is no one gives a crap about what you did last week. This league is about what have you done for me now. That's the NFL. It's also our culture. So you keep working hard because that's the biggest truth about football.
Quotes.author: Andrew Luck

Quotes.quote: The belief that there is only one truth, and that oneself is in possession of it, is the root of all evil in the world.
Quotes.author: Max Born

Quotes.quote: Prayer is the spirit speaking truth to Truth.
Quotes.author: Philip James Bailey

Quotes.quote: God help us from those who believe that they are the sole possessors of truth. How we manage at times to agree willingly to become prisoners within our own minds and souls of beliefs and ideas on which we can never be flexible.
Quotes.author: King Hussein I

Quotes.quote: No human being is constituted to know the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth; and even the best of men must be content with fragments, with partial glimpses, never the full fruition.
Quotes.author: William Osler

Quotes.quote: My idea of a delicious time is to read a book that is wonderful. But the ruling passion of my life is being a seeker after truth and the divine.
Quotes.author: bell hooks

Quotes.quote: Truth never comes into the world but like a bastard, to the ignominy of him that brought her birth.
Quotes.author: John Milton

Quotes.quote: We cannot know the whole truth, which belongs to God alone, but our task nevertheless is to seek to know what is true. And if we offend gravely enough against what we know to be true, as by failing badly enough to deal affectionately and responsibly with our land and our neighbors, truth will retaliate with ugliness, poverty, and disease.
Quotes.author: Wendell Berry

Quotes.quote: If now isn't a good time for the truth I don't see when we'll get to it.
Quotes.author: Nikki Giovanni

Quotes.quote: Never wear your best trousers when you go out to fight for freedom and truth.
Quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen

Quotes.quote: Trust your gut feeling about things, listen to what others are saying, and look at the results of your actions. Once you know the truth, you can set about taking action to improve. Everyone will be better for it.
Quotes.author: Jack Canfield

Quotes.quote: Don't try to tear down other people's religion about their ears, Build up your own perfect structure of truth, and invite your listeners to enter in and enjoy it's glories.
Quotes.author: Brigham Young

Quotes.quote: I find being funny very hard work. I am always asked about it, and I feel guilty saying that, but it's the truth. I love my work, but it ain't easy.
Quotes.author: Madeline Kahn

Quotes.quote: She gave up beauty in her tender youth, gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways; she covered up her eyes lest they should gaze on vanity, and chose the bitter truth.
Quotes.author: Christina Rossetti

Quotes.quote: I am in the present. I cannot know what tomorrow will bring forth. I can know only what the truth is for me today. That is what I am called upon to serve, and I serve it in all lucidity.
Quotes.author: Igor Stravinsky

Quotes.quote: If we were to abandon concern for what is true, what is false, and what remains indeterminate, the world would be totally chaotic. Even those who deny the importance of truth, on the one hand, are quick to jump on anyone who is caught lying.
Quotes.author: Howard Gardner

Quotes.quote: A lot of people in the media, and some everyday people, really aren't in search of the truth. They're in search of something worse than that. Money, yeah. I think the media's the kind of a thing where the truth doesn't win, because it's no fun. The truth's no fun.
Quotes.author: Jack White

Quotes.quote: We've had a major shift in what truth is and where it comes from. We've gone from being God-centered to self-centered, from being objective to being subjective, and from being internal to external.
Quotes.author: Josh McDowell

Quotes.quote: Vagueness is at times an indication of nearness to a perfect truth.
Quotes.author: Charles Ives

Quotes.quote: I never told a victim story about my imprisonment. Instead, I told a transformation story - about how prison changed my outlook, about how I saw that communication, truth, and trust are at the heart of power.
Quotes.author: Fernando Flores

Quotes.quote: Liberated from the error of pagan tradition through the benevolence and loving kindness of the good God with the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the operation of the Holy Spirit, I was reared from the very beginning by Christian parents. From them I learned even in babyhood the Holy Scriptures which led me to a knowledge of the truth.
Quotes.author: Saint Basil

Quotes.quote: The truth doesn't change. It was the same when Moses got the Ten Commandments as it is today. That's the thing about the truth. That's the thing about real. It doesn't change and it doesn't have to change. Now you can put it in a different book, but it's still real. It's still the truth.
Quotes.author: DMX

Quotes.quote: Truth is Mormonism. God is the author of it.
Quotes.author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

Quotes.quote: We talk about honesty, but the reality is we have lots of human values, and they are not all compatible. We don't always tell the truth about everything, no matter what the consequences.
Quotes.author: Dan Ariely

Quotes.quote: Never question the relevance of truth, but always question the truth of relevance.
Quotes.author: Craig Bruce

Quotes.quote: Seek truth from facts.
Quotes.author: Deng Xiaoping

Quotes.quote: Science is the pursuit of pure truth, and the systematizing of it.
Quotes.author: P. T. Barnum

Quotes.quote: A science is something which is constructed from truth on workable axioms. There are 55 axioms in scientology which are very demonstrably true, and on these can be constructed a great deal.
Quotes.author: L. Ron Hubbard

Quotes.quote: Why waste time trying to discover the truth, when you can so easily create it?
Quotes.author: David Baldacci

Quotes.quote: It seems, by today's standards, that it's better to seek approval than to tell the truth. It's better to utter sweet nothings than to boldly say something of substance.
Quotes.author: Monica Johnson

Quotes.quote: False history gets made all day, any day, the truth of the new is never on the news.
Quotes.author: Adrienne Rich

Quotes.quote: The real issue behind these people who are gun grabbers, the truth is - based on fact - the reason why is, they want control. They want control of the people. That's what socialism is and communism.
Quotes.author: Luke Scott

Quotes.quote: Truth is absolute, truth is supreme, truth is never disposable in national political life.
Quotes.author: John Howard

Quotes.quote: Often times we feel like either we can't make a world of difference, or we feel that it's not going to change anything anyway. The truth is you can change someone's day, you can change someone's life, but you have to show up and do what you got to do to actually see any fruit coming from it.
Quotes.author: Nick Vujicic

Quotes.quote: The second one, the joint Truth and Friendship Commission, which we started now with Indonesia, that is the one that has been criticized; its terms of reference call for providing amnesty for those who cooperate in telling the truth. It does not lead to prosecution.
Quotes.author: Jose Ramos-Horta

Quotes.quote: I believe that truth has only one face: that of a violent contradiction.
Quotes.author: Georges Bataille

Quotes.quote: How sweet the words of Truth, breathed from the lips of Love.
Quotes.author: James Beattie

Quotes.quote: I was born in Hoboken. I am an American. Photography is my passion. The search for Truth my obsession.
Quotes.author: Alfred Stieglitz

Quotes.quote: I am for gay marriage. Or same-sex marriage. I don't want to say it the wrong way. I think people are sensitive to it. I have been painted as being this right-wing zealot on choice. Nothing could be further from the truth.
Quotes.author: Harold Ford, Jr.

Quotes.quote: The one thing I have never been afraid of is standing before important people and speaking my mind. I represent women who may never have the opportunity to go to the UN or meet with a president. I'm never afraid to speak truth to power.
Quotes.author: Leymah Gbowee

Quotes.quote: I tend not to dwell on the parallels between chess and business, chess and the martial arts, or any two things for that matter, because the truth is that all pursuits are connected if we gain an eye for the thematic links.
Quotes.author: Joshua Waitzkin

Quotes.quote: Most jokes state a bitter truth.
Quotes.author: Larry Gelbart

Quotes.quote: The truth is, I can't help the way people perceive anything, from the role of financial industry in the economic crisis, to the place of women's fiction in the canon of modern literature, to the rank of mint chocolate chip ice cream as a favorite Baskin-Robbins flavor.
Quotes.author: Erin Duffy

Quotes.quote: For Africa to me... is more than a glamorous fact. It is a historical truth. No man can know where he is going unless he knows exactly where he has been and exactly how he arrived at his present place.
Quotes.author: Maya Angelou

Quotes.quote: All of us knows, not what is expedient, not what is going to make us popular, not what the policy is, or the company policy - but in truth each of us knows what is the right thing to do. And that's how I am guided.
Quotes.author: Maya Angelou

Quotes.quote: I promised myself that I would write as well as I can, tell the truth, not to tell everything I know, but to make sure that everything I tell is true, as I understand it. And to use the eloquence which my language affords me.
Quotes.author: Maya Angelou

Quotes.quote: The truth is that parents are not really interested in justice. They just want quiet.
Quotes.author: Bill Cosby

Quotes.quote: For though we love both the truth and our friends, piety requires us to honor the truth first.
Quotes.author: Aristotle

Quotes.quote: We have art in order not to die of the truth.
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: Exaggeration is truth that has lost its temper.
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: All truth is simple... is that not doubly a lie?
Quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes.quote: The lawyer's truth is not Truth, but consistency or a consistent expediency.
Quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes.quote: Expectations are a form of first-class truth: If people believe it, it's true.
Quotes.author: Bill Gates

Quotes.quote: The truth is, hardly any of us have ethical energy enough for more than one really inflexible point of honor.
Quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes.quote: Truth is the beginning of every good to the gods, and of every good to man.
Quotes.author: Plato

Quotes.quote: If you ever injected truth into politics you have no politics.
Quotes.author: Will Rogers

Quotes.quote: Wisdom is found only in truth.
Quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes.quote: I am very fond of truth, but not at all of martyrdom.
Quotes.author: Voltaire

Quotes.quote: Of course it's the same old story. Truth usually is the same old story.
Quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

Quotes.quote: If you seek truth you will not seek victory by dishonorable means, and if you find truth you will become invincible.
Quotes.author: Epictetus

Quotes.quote: To be outspoken is easy when you do not wait to speak the complete truth.
Quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes.quote: Love is not a mere impulse, it must contain truth, which is law.
Quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes.quote: He who does not bellow the truth when he knows the truth makes himself the accomplice of liars and forgers.
Quotes.author: Charles Peguy

Quotes.quote: Individuals need to be willing to face truth about their attitudes, behaviors, even what we want out of life.
Quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

Quotes.quote: It may not always be easy, convenient, or politically correct to stand for truth and right, but it is the right thing to do. Always.
Quotes.author: M. Russell Ballard

Quotes.quote: The enlightenment is under threat. So is reason. So is truth. So is science, especially in the schools of America.
Quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

Quotes.quote: I wanted to write about the moment when your addictions no longer hide the truth from you. When your whole life breaks down. That's the moment when you have to somehow choose what your life is going to be about.
Quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quotes.quote: The truth is on the march and nothing will stop it.
Quotes.author: Emile Zola

Quotes.quote: The great quest of life has always been to discover truth.
Quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

Quotes.quote: I think it better that in times like these a poet's mouth be silent, for in truth we have no gift to set a statesman right.
Quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

Quotes.quote: Falsehood has an infinity of combinations, but truth has only one mode of being.
Quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quotes.quote: It is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.
Quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes.quote: The truth of our faith becomes a matter of ridicule among the infidels if any Catholic, not gifted with the necessary scientific learning, presents as dogma what scientific scrutiny shows to be false.
Quotes.author: Thomas Aquinas

Quotes.quote: The dreamer can know no truth, not even about his dream, except by awaking out of it.
Quotes.author: George Santayana

Quotes.quote: I think my love of truth and honesty forces me to notice that the liberal intelligentsia of Western countries is betraying itself where Islam is concerned.
Quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

Quotes.quote: Quick condemnation of all that is not ours, of views with which we disagree, of ideas that do not attract us, is the sign of a narrow mind, of an uncultivated intelligence. Bigotry is always ignorant, and the wise boy, who will become the wise man, tries to understand and to see the truth in ideas with which he does not agree.
Quotes.author: Annie Besant

Quotes.quote: Heresies are experiments in man's unsatisfied search for truth.
Quotes.author: H. G. Wells

Quotes.quote: Violence does, in truth, recoil upon the violent, and the schemer falls into the pit which he digs for another.
Quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quotes.quote: What does it matter how one comes by the truth so long as one pounces upon it and lives by it?
Quotes.author: Henry Miller

Quotes.quote: I put forward formless and unresolved notions, as do those who publish doubtful questions to debate in the schools, not to establish the truth but to seek it.
Quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

Quotes.quote: I would rather be uncomfortable with the truth than to be lied to in comfort. That's just my nature.
Quotes.author: Jesse Ventura

Quotes.quote: Intense feeling too often obscures the truth.
Quotes.author: Harry S Truman

Quotes.quote: The world is indeed a mixture of truth and make-believe. Discard the make-believe and take the truth.
Quotes.author: Ramakrishna

Quotes.quote: From principles is derived probability, but truth or certainty is obtained only from facts.
Quotes.author: Tom Stoppard

Quotes.quote: It is a simple but sometimes forgotten truth that the greatest enemy to present joy and high hopes is the cultivation of retrospective bitterness.
Quotes.author: Robert Menzies

Quotes.quote: Hip-hop reflects the truth, and the problem is that hip-hop exposes a lot of the negative truth that society tries to conceal. It's a platform where we could offer information, but it's also an escape.
Quotes.author: Busta Rhymes

Quotes.quote: There are new words now that excuse everybody. Give me the good old days of heroes and villains, the people you can bravo or hiss. There was a truth to them that all the slick credulity of today cannot touch.
Quotes.author: Bette Davis

Quotes.quote: I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth.
Quotes.author: Umberto Eco

Quotes.quote: Fixed principles of truth are the only safeguard for youth.
Quotes.author: Ellen G. White

Quotes.quote: The dictum that truth always triumphs over persecution is one of the pleasant falsehoods which men repeat after one another till they pass into commonplaces, but which all experience refutes.
Quotes.author: John Stuart Mill

Quotes.quote: Sometimes I dread the truth of the lines I say. But the dread must never show.
Quotes.author: Vivien Leigh

Quotes.quote: Man has gone long enough, or even too long, without being man enough to face the simple truth that the trouble with man is man.
Quotes.author: James Thurber

Quotes.quote: The American fascists are most easily recognized by their deliberate perversion of truth and fact. Their newspapers and propaganda carefully cultivate every fissure of disunity, every crack in the common front against fascism.
Quotes.author: Henry A. Wallace

Quotes.quote: There is a tragic clash between Truth and the world. Pure undistorted truth burns up the world.
Quotes.author: Nikolai Berdyaev

Quotes.quote: Be truthful, nature only sides with truth.
Quotes.author: Adolf Loos

Quotes.quote: Truth is in things, and not in words.
Quotes.author: Herman Melville

Quotes.quote: The Assembly has witnessed over the last weeks how historical truth is established; once an allegation has been repeated a few times, it is no longer an allegation, it is an established fact, even if no evidence has been brought out in order to support it.
Quotes.author: Dag Hammarskjold

Quotes.quote: Truth is the ultimate power. When the truth comes around, all the lies have to run and hide.
Quotes.author: Ice Cube

Quotes.quote: The truth is that I know very few novelists who have been satisfied with the adaptation of their books for the screen.
Quotes.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

Quotes.quote: Philosophy is a kind of journey, ever learning yet never arriving at the ideal perfection of truth.
Quotes.author: Albert Pike

Quotes.quote: It is not the possession of truth, but the success which attends the seeking after it, that enriches the seeker and brings happiness to him.
Quotes.author: Max Planck

Quotes.quote: Not truth, but faith, it is that keeps the world alive.
Quotes.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quotes.quote: Alas! they had been friends in youth; but whispering tongues can poison truth.
Quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quotes.quote: Wallow too much in sensitivity and you can't deal with life, or the truth.
Quotes.author: Neal Boortz

Quotes.quote: In order to feel loved, be respected and stay connected, we humans have a tendency to lie. We lie about who we are, what we want, what we need, what we have done or will do. Perhaps 'lie' is too strong a word. Let me say that what we do is withhold the truth.
Quotes.author: Iyanla Vanzant

Quotes.quote: A priest is he who lives solely in the realm of the invisible, for whom all that is visible has only the truth of an allegory.
Quotes.author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

Quotes.quote: Using the power you derive from the discovery of the truth about racism in South Africa, you will help us to remake our part of the world into a corner of the globe on which all - of which all of humanity can be proud.
Quotes.author: Oliver Tambo

Quotes.quote: To any artist, worthy of the name, all in nature is beautiful, because his eyes, fearlessly accepting all exterior truth, read there, as in an open book, all the inner truth.
Quotes.author: Auguste Rodin

Quotes.quote: The first holy truth in God 101 is that men and women of true faith have always had to accept the mystery of God's identity and love and ways. I hate that, but it's the truth.
Quotes.author: Anne Lamott

Quotes.quote: To attempt seeing Truth without knowing Falsehood. It is the attempt to see the Light without knowing the Darkness. It cannot be.
Quotes.author: Frank Herbert

Quotes.quote: A few observation and much reasoning lead to error; many observations and a little reasoning to truth.
Quotes.author: Alexis Carrel

Quotes.quote: One can re-create what was in the mind of a mathematician a thousand years ago, recapture the truth of the intellect wherever it may have once come to light; but the image of art, that infinite variable of perception and expression in the individual, - that is not easily re-created, at least, not with certainty and in its original fulness.
Quotes.author: George Edward Woodberry

Quotes.quote: Truth is, I think, if God just gave us our daily bread, many of us would be angry. 'That's all you're going to give me? You're just going to give me enough to sustain me for today? What about tomorrow or next year or 10, 20, 30 years from now? I want to know that I'm set up.' And yet Jesus says just pray for your daily provisions.
Quotes.author: Francis Chan

Quotes.quote: The three-year-old who lies about taking a cookie isn't really a liar after all. He simply can't control his impulses. He then convinces himself of a new truth and, eager for your approval, reports the version that he knows will make you happy.
Quotes.author: Cathy Rindner Tempelsman

Quotes.quote: If you spend a lot of time lying to people, you think a lot about what the truth means.
Quotes.author: Penn Jillette

Quotes.quote: We're not going to have the America that we want until we elect leaders who are going to tell the truth - not most days, but every day.
Quotes.author: Ann Richards

Quotes.quote: Back in the late '90s, I put together a humorous newsmagazine program called 'The Awful Truth' for Bravo. We helped one guy get an organ transplant whose insurance company had refused to pay. I thought, if we could save a guy's life in a 10-minute segment on cable, what could we do if we devoted a whole movie to a whole bunch of people?
Quotes.author: Michael Moore

Quotes.quote: Until we have a better relationship between private performance and the public truth, as was demonstrated with Watergate, we as the public are absolutely right to remain suspicious, contemptuous even, of the secrecy and the misinformation which is the digest of our news.
Quotes.author: John le Carre

Quotes.quote: I am not struck so much by the diversity of testimony as by the many-sidedness of truth.
Quotes.author: Stanley Baldwin

Quotes.quote: I kind of got my big break with 'The Princess Diaries' and during the press rounds for that everyone asked me: 'Did you always want to be a princess growing up?' And the truth was, no I wanted to be Catwoman.
Quotes.author: Anne Hathaway

Quotes.quote: Truth is the cry of all, but the game of few.
Quotes.author: George Berkeley

Quotes.quote: I believe that in the end the truth will conquer.
Quotes.author: John Wycliffe

Quotes.quote: I tell the truth, and I expose myself as a weak, misguided, misdirected, dysfunctional human being I used to be.
Quotes.author: Russell Means

Quotes.quote: Semantics is about the relation of words to thoughts, but it also about the relation of words to other human concerns. Semantics is about the relation of words to reality - the way that speakers commit themselves to a shared understanding of the truth, and the way their thoughts are anchored to things and situations in the world.
Quotes.author: Steven Pinker

Quotes.quote: In truth, the only restrictions on our capacity to astonish ourselves and each other are imposed by our own minds.
Quotes.author: David Blaine

Quotes.quote: Such truth, as opposeth no man's profit, nor pleasure, is to all men welcome.
Quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

Quotes.quote: There is no power on earth more formidable than the truth.
Quotes.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

Quotes.quote: There is an element of truth in every idea that lasts long enough to be called corny.
Quotes.author: Irving Berlin

Quotes.quote: Now, I know you expected me to say that, well, I just kick back in the rocking chair, fished a little bit, listened to Willie Nelson tapes and watched old baseball games on the Classic Sports network. And, tell you the truth, I have done that for maybe about five total minutes.
Quotes.author: Dan Rather

Quotes.quote: If the reporter has killed our imagination with his truth, he threatens our life with his lies.
Quotes.author: Karl Kraus

Quotes.quote: As for the men in power, they are so anxious to establish the myth of infallibility that they do their utmost to ignore truth.
Quotes.author: Boris Pasternak

Quotes.quote: The design of Rhetoric is to remove those Prejudices that lie in the way of Truth, to Reduce the Passions to the Government of Reasons; to place our Subject in a Right Light, and excite our Hearers to a due consideration of it.
Quotes.author: Mary Astell

Quotes.quote: The truth is that our way of celebrating the Christmas season does spring from myriad cultures and sources, from St. Nicholas to Coca-Cola advertising campaigns.
Quotes.author: Richard Roeper

Quotes.quote: The truth is that Oxford is simply a very beautiful city in which it is convenient to segregate a certain number of the young of the nation while they are growing up.
Quotes.author: Evelyn Waugh

Quotes.quote: I'm craving more soul, I'm craving more truth, I'm craving more socially - just people that are aware of what's going on in the world.
Quotes.author: John Legend

Quotes.quote: More and more, as I get older, people come up to me and say, 'Thank you for all the laughter.' And my standard answer is, 'It was my pleasure.' But that's the truth.
Quotes.author: Bob Newhart

Quotes.quote: I'm not saying everything out there is bad and toxic, but there are some things that are not scriptural. For example, some people don't understand that the law was given by Moses, but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.
Quotes.author: Joseph Prince

Quotes.quote: The reason for the sadness of this modern age and the men who live in it is that it looks for the truth in everything and finds it.
Quotes.author: Edmond de Goncourt

Quotes.quote: The truth is that many powerful guys have fooled around while working for the people. Dwight Eisenhower, John F. Kennedy, and Warren Harding to name just a few. Grover Cleveland even fathered a child outside of marriage. We all know these things happen. But we don't want them to happen - at least most of us don't. I can't speak for San Francisco.
Quotes.author: Bill O'Reilly

Quotes.quote: Trust is a core currency of any relationship. Sometimes our need to control and micromanage everything erodes our confidence in ourselves and others. The truth: People are much more capable than we think. A hearty dose of trust is often what's needed to unlock the magic. Go ahead, have faith.
Quotes.author: Kris Carr

Quotes.quote: What I claim is to live to the full the contradiction of my time, which may well make sarcasm the condition of truth.
Quotes.author: Roland Barthes

Quotes.quote: The truth was you can't continue to spend the kind of money our spending on all these entitlement programs. I think we need more people in public life who are willing to say, no, we can't afford certain things. No, we can't do certain things.
Quotes.author: Chris Christie

Quotes.quote: Heaven and God are not high above us, far away; they are deep within us. Heaven is not a distant country where there are trees and houses and other objects; it is a plane of consciousness within us. Seekers of the eternal Truth will realise their eternal Heaven within their aspiring hearts.
Quotes.author: Sri Chinmoy

Quotes.quote: Love and compassion don't at all have to make us weak, or lead us to losing discernment and vision. We just have to learn how to find them. And see, in truth, what they bring us.
Quotes.author: Sharon Salzberg

Quotes.quote: Someone needs to tell the truth, but it shouldn't be my job.
Quotes.author: Thom Yorke

Quotes.quote: The eye by long use comes to see even in the darkest cavern: and there is no subject so obscure but we may discern some glimpse of truth by long poring on it.
Quotes.author: George Berkeley

Quotes.quote: The immediate future is going to be tragic for all of us unless we find a way of making the vast educational resources of this country serve the true purpose of education, truth and justice.
Quotes.author: Anne Sullivan

Quotes.quote: A sincere seeker knows what his goal is: the highest Truth. He will not delay his journey. In spiritual life, we aspire for the highest Truth, for God, nothing else.
Quotes.author: Sri Chinmoy

Quotes.quote: You know that everyone thinks that in order to do South Park we must be wild, crazy, rock and roll stars. But the truth is we're just wholesome middle-American guys. We enjoy soda pop, baseball and beating up old people just as much as anybody.
Quotes.author: Trey Parker

Quotes.quote: Despite the fact that in America we incarcerate more juveniles for life terms than in any other country in the world, the truth is that the vast majority of youth offenders will one day be released. The question is simple and stark. Do we want to help them change or do we want to help them become even more violent and dangerous?
Quotes.author: Ayelet Waldman

Quotes.quote: Hope is nature's veil for hiding truth's nakedness.
Quotes.author: Alfred Nobel

Quotes.quote: I'm very good at breaking up with people. Very good. It requires a lot of skill, but what you do is you tell them the truth of why you are breaking up with them, and after that, you somehow compensate with other things. If you have loved someone, I think that somehow they should always be a part of your life. I really do.
Quotes.author: Diane von Furstenberg

Quotes.quote: The original fairy tale was about the youngest sister going into a room in the castle and finding all the bodies of the wives that came before her - she is confronted with truth, thinking about how often we think we know people and we really don't.
Quotes.author: Alice Hoffman

Quotes.quote: But the truth of the matter is, we're an open society, we want to remain an open society, and there will continue to be vulnerability. That's why we have to meet the threats when they are not yet taking place on our territory and on our soil.
Quotes.author: Condoleezza Rice

Quotes.quote: In Mexico, when we want to speak deep secrets, we drink pulgue together. It is a drink made from the cactus plant, and when you take the bottle from your mouth, it leaves a string behind, between the mouth and the bottle, like a spider's web. It shows that the truth sticks inside.
Quotes.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

Quotes.quote: In all science, error precedes the truth, and it is better it should go first than last.
Quotes.author: Hugh Walpole

Quotes.quote: It is proper that noble spirits, equipped with truth and enlightened with the Divine intelligence, should arm themselves against dense ignorance by climbing up to the high rock and tower of contemplation.
Quotes.author: Giordano Bruno

Quotes.quote: Humor is the truth; wit is an exaggeration of the truth.
Quotes.author: Stan Laurel

Quotes.quote: To begin with myself, then, the utterances of men concerning me will differ widely, since in passing judgment almost every one is influenced not so much by truth as by preference, and good and evil report alike know no bounds.
Quotes.author: Petrarch

Quotes.quote: The real truth is that the Obama administration is professional at bullying, as we have witnessed with ACORN at work during the presidential campaign. It seems to me they are sending down their bullies to create fist fights among average American citizens who don't want a government-run health care plan forced upon them.
Quotes.author: Jon Voight

Quotes.quote: It is difficult to separate, at times, the myth from the truth.
Quotes.author: Bob Kane

Quotes.quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
Quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes.quote: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
Quotes.author: Chanakya

Quotes.quote: The dream begins with a teacher who believes in you, who tugs and pushes and leads you to the next plateau, sometimes poking you with a sharp stick called 'truth'.
Quotes.author: Dan Rather

Quotes.quote: The books that help you most are those which make you think that most. The hardest way of learning is that of easy reading; but a great book that comes from a great thinker is a ship of thought, deep freighted with truth and beauty.
Quotes.author: Pablo Neruda

Quotes.quote: The Bible is one of the greatest blessings bestowed by God on the children of men. It has God for its author; salvation for its end, and truth without any mixture for its matter. It is all pure.
Quotes.author: John Locke

Quotes.quote: Honesty is more than not lying. It is truth telling, truth speaking, truth living, and truth loving.
Quotes.author: James E. Faust

Quotes.quote: Women must tell men always that they are the strong ones. They are the big, the strong, the wonderful. In truth, women are the strong ones. It is just my opinion, I am not a professor.
Quotes.author: Coco Chanel

Quotes.quote: It's in literature that true life can be found. It's under the mask of fiction that you can tell the truth.
Quotes.author: Gao Xingjian

Quotes.quote: I learned a long time ago that some people would rather die than forgive. It's a strange truth, but forgiveness is a painful and difficult process. It's not something that happens overnight. It's an evolution of the heart.
Quotes.author: Sue Monk Kidd

Quotes.quote: Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand.
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: Peace demands the most heroic labor and the most difficult sacrifice. It demands greater heroism than war. It demands greater fidelity to the truth and a much more perfect purity of conscience.
Quotes.author: Thomas Merton

Quotes.quote: There is no greatness where there is no simplicity, goodness and truth.
Quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

Quotes.quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
Quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

Quotes.quote: Light is meaningful only in relation to darkness, and truth presupposes error. It is these mingled opposites which people our life, which make it pungent, intoxicating. We only exist in terms of this conflict, in the zone where black and white clash.
Quotes.author: Louis Aragon

Quotes.quote: A liar will not be believed, even when he speaks the truth.
Quotes.author: Aesop

Quotes.quote: It's a complete lie, why do people buy these papers? It's not the truth I'm here to say. You know, don't judge a person, do not pass judgement, unless you have talked to them one on one. I don't care what the story is, do not judge them because it is a lie.
Quotes.author: Michael Jackson

Quotes.quote: Love is the crowning grace of humanity, the holiest right of the soul, the golden link which binds us to duty and truth, the redeeming principle that chiefly reconciles the heart to life, and is prophetic of eternal good.
Quotes.author: Petrarch

Quotes.quote: Despite my firm convictions, I have always been a man who tries to face facts, and to accept the reality of life as new experience and new knowledge unfolds. I have always kept an open mind, a flexibility that must go hand in hand with every form of the intelligent search for truth.
Quotes.author: Malcolm X

Quotes.quote: Belief is a wise wager. Granted that faith cannot be proved, what harm will come to you if you gamble on its truth and it proves false? If you gain, you gain all; if you lose, you lose nothing. Wager, then, without hesitation, that He exists.
Quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes.quote: Genocide is not just a murderous madness; it is, more deeply, a politics that promises a utopia beyond politics - one people, one land, one truth, the end of difference. Since genocide is a form of political utopia, it remains an enduring temptation in any multiethnic and multicultural society in crisis.
Quotes.author: Michael Ignatieff

Quotes.quote: Free expression is the base of human rights, the root of human nature and the mother of truth. To kill free speech is to insult human rights, to stifle human nature and to suppress truth.
Quotes.author: Liu Xiaobo

Quotes.quote: Find out who you are and be that person. That's what your soul was put on this Earth to be. Find that truth, live that truth and everything else will come.
Quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quotes.quote: If you want to be thought a liar, always tell the truth.
Quotes.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

Quotes.quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
Quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

Quotes.quote: I tell you the truth, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven. Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.
Quotes.author: Jesus Christ

Quotes.quote: The trouble with lying and deceiving is that their efficiency depends entirely upon a clear notion of the truth that the liar and deceiver wishes to hide.
Quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

Quotes.quote: In a controversy the instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves.
Quotes.author: Buddha

Quotes.quote: Truth, according to the Christian faith, is God's love for us in Jesus Christ. Therefore, truth is a relationship.
Quotes.author: Pope Francis

Quotes.quote: The truth is: Belonging starts with self-acceptance. Your level of belonging, in fact, can never be greater than your level of self-acceptance, because believing that you're enough is what gives you the courage to be authentic, vulnerable and imperfect.
Quotes.author: Brene Brown

Quotes.quote: The best way to obtain truth and wisdom is not to ask from books, but to go to God in prayer, and obtain divine teaching.
Quotes.author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

Quotes.quote: The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls.
Quotes.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

Quotes.quote: Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it.
Quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

Quotes.quote: To love our neighbor as ourselves is such a truth for regulating human society, that by that alone one might determine all the cases in social morality.
Quotes.author: John Locke

Quotes.quote: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.
Quotes.author: Herman Melville

Quotes.quote: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: Why, when we know that there's no such thing as perfect, do most of us spend an incredible amount of time and energy trying to be everything to everyone? Is it that we really admire perfection? No - the truth is that we are actually drawn to people who are real and down-to-earth. We love authenticity and we know that life is messy and imperfect.
Quotes.author: Brene Brown

Quotes.quote: Let me get you to understand I don't bully anybody. I stand up for what I believe in and I'm very honest and I always tell the truth. I'm not a liar, I'm not manipulative and I don't stab you in your back because I will stab you in your chest.
Quotes.author: NeNe Leakes

Quotes.quote: It is not because the truth is too difficult to see that we make mistakes... we make mistakes because the easiest and most comfortable course for us is to seek insight where it accords with our emotions - especially selfish ones.
Quotes.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

Quotes.quote: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
Quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes.quote: The discovery of truth is prevented more effectively, not by the false appearance things present and which mislead into error, not directly by weakness of the reasoning powers, but by preconceived opinion, by prejudice.
Quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quotes.quote: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
Quotes.author: Sylvester Stallone

Quotes.quote: I will be as harsh as truth, and uncompromising as justice... I am in earnest, I will not equivocate, I will not excuse, I will not retreat a single inch, and I will be heard.
Quotes.author: William Lloyd Garrison

Quotes.quote: I'm supposed to have a Ph.D. on the subject of women. But the truth is I've flunked more often than not. I'm very fond of women; I admire them. But, like all men, I don't understand them.
Quotes.author: Frank Sinatra

Quotes.quote: If religion were true, its followers would not try to bludgeon their young into an artificial conformity; but would merely insist on their unbending quest for truth, irrespective of artificial backgrounds or practical consequences.
Quotes.author: H. P. Lovecraft

Quotes.quote: I'm actually a very honest person, and sometimes I end up like, 'Man, I said too much.' It's hard for me not to tell the truth when you ask me.
Quotes.author: Drake

Quotes.quote: Sex is full of lies. The body tries to tell the truth. But, it's usually too battered with rules to be heard, and bound with pretenses so it can hardly move. We cripple ourselves with lies.
Quotes.author: Jim Morrison

Quotes.quote: We all have a social mask, right? We put it on, we go out, put our best foot forward, our best image. But behind that social mask is a personal truth, what we really, really believe about who we are and what we're capable of.
Quotes.author: Phil McGraw

Quotes.quote: Your days are short here; this is the last of your springs. And now in the serenity and quiet of this lovely place, touch the depths of truth, feel the hem of Heaven. You will go away with old, good friends. And don't forget when you leave why you came.
Quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

Quotes.quote: It's in the history books, the Holocaust. It's just a phrase. And the truth is it happened yesterday. It happened to my mother. I never met my grandmothers or my grandfathers. They were all wiped up in the gas chambers of Nazi Germany.
Quotes.author: Gene Simmons

Quotes.quote: A man has to learn that he cannot command things, but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others, but that he can mold and master his own will: and things serve him who serves Truth; people seek guidance of him who is master of himself.
Quotes.author: James Allen

Quotes.quote: One of the reasons people hate politics is that truth is rarely a politician's objective. Election and power are.
Quotes.author: Cal Thomas

Quotes.quote: Great is truth, but still greater, from a practical point of view, is silence about truth. By simply not mentioning certain subjects... totalitarian propagandists have influenced opinion much more effectively than they could have by the most eloquent denunciations.
Quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

Quotes.quote: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
Quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes.quote: I trust you: That's huge. That's truth. That's real love. Everyone uses 'I love you' so loosely.
Quotes.author: Justin Chatwin

Quotes.quote: The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives.
Quotes.author: Albert Einstein

Quotes.quote: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.
Quotes.author: Alan Watts

Quotes.quote: The most powerful element in advertising is the truth.
Quotes.author: William Bernbach

Quotes.quote: We live in an age where there is a firehose of information, and there is no hierarchy of what is important and what is not. Where the truth is often fashioned through a variety of digital means. Are you your avatar? Who are you in social media? What face do you turn toward the world? How much does it have in common with who you actually are?
Quotes.author: David Carr

Quotes.quote: I know that campaigns can seem small, and even silly. Trivial things become big distractions. Serious issues become sound bites. And the truth gets buried under an avalanche of money and advertising. If you're sick of hearing me approve this message, believe me - so am I.
Quotes.author: Barack Obama

Quotes.quote: The theatre was created to tell people the truth about life and the social situation.
Quotes.author: Stella Adler

Quotes.quote: My way of joking is to tell the truth. That's the funniest joke in the world.
Quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

Quotes.quote: Most people think that shadows follow, precede or surround beings or objects. The truth is that they also surround words, ideas, desires, deeds, impulses and memories.
Quotes.author: Elie Wiesel
